title: Teamcenter Developer/Specialist
description:
We are looking for a Teamcenter Developer/Specialist for a leading company in the energy technology sector.


This is a consulting assignment.


The role is based in Ludvika.


The position is full-time.


The assignment involves close collaboration with the client, requiring a high degree of flexibility and teamwork.

**Assignment**


We are seeking a SE Siemens Teamcenter Developer/Specialist (Level 3) for an organization in Ludvika. The role involves developing and customizing solutions within the Siemens Teamcenter environment, working closely with the development team to meet business requirements and adhere to best practices in PLM (Product Lifecycle Management).

**Responsibilities**


Develop and customize Teamcenter solutions using both configuration and custom code/scripts.


Perform ITK server-side programming in C/C++, Java for dispatcher clients, and XML for stylesheet definitions.


Utilize tools such as BMIDE, Workflow Designer, and Query Builder for continuous development.


Troubleshoot and resolve issues in existing code based on user or team reports.


Support the development team with technical expertise in programming.


Incorporate PLM/Teamcenter development best practices.


Integrate Teamcenter solutions with third-party applications such as SAP4Hana, NX, and ECAD tools.


Configure and customize Active Workspace and Teamcenter architecture/data model.


Install and configure 2-Tier & 4-Tier clients, file management servers, dispatcher servers, and CAD integrations.

 **Requirements (Mandatory)**


3-5 years of work experience within the relevant field and a bachelor or master’s degree.  

  

Another IT degree with more than 15 years of work experience within relevant field.  

  

Working command of the English language.  

  

Proficiency in at least one of the following programming languages: C/C++, C#, Java, or XML/XSLT.  

  

Strong knowledge of Teamcenter APIs and the Dispatcher framework.  

  

Experience with Active Workspace configuration and customization.  

  

Familiarity with Git (Azure DevOps) for code management.  

  

Understanding of Teamcenter UA products, including Engineering Data Management, BOM Management, Workflow, and Change Management.  

  

Experience in Teamcenter client-server customization and SOA customization.  

  

Basic problem-solving skills for application issues and root cause analysis.  

  

Exposure to real-time customer environments and implementation of Teamcenter product solutions.

**Preferred / Advantageous**


Additional language skills, such as Swedish, are considered an advantage.  

  

Experience with Product Configurator, Multi BOM Management, Service BOM, or Supplier Collaboration in TC and AWC latest versions.  

  

Knowledge of transitioning from RAC to AWC, understanding the TC AWC data model and Multi BOM Management capabilities.

 **Personal Attributes**


Self-motivated and able to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.  

  

Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate clearly at all levels of the organization.  

  

Creative mindset with excellent problem-solving abilities.  

  

Natural leadership qualities and the ability to resolve issues efficiently.

 **About Us**


Centio's overarching goal is to be a consulting company that offers smart and sustainable solutions that positively contribute to societal development.


Our employees are offered conditions tailored to the individual. This means that working hours, workload, workplace, and professional development are, as far as possible, adapted to the employee's needs.


Among our team, you will find dedicated individuals who are passionate about societal progress. We work in small groups where you can contribute your experiences while also benefiting from the knowledge and expertise of others.


Well-being and achieving a healthy work-life balance are important to us. Therefore, we have a zero-tolerance policy toward stress and prioritize workplace happiness and health.


For more information, please visit centio.se.

**Please submit your CV in English.**


We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Backend Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Strong experience with Java and backend systems architecture
* Experience working with relational databases (especially PostgreSQL)
* Familiarity with GraphQL and TypeScript is a strong plus
* Comfort working across multiple systems and collaborating with frontend developers

  

**Meritorious**  

* Experience working on publishing platforms or CMSs, or in environments where internal users are the primary customers

  

**Application deadline:** 27-11-2025 **About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

Här tror vi på frihet, möjligheter och medbestämmande. Att du som medarbetare ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas och forma ditt arbete utefter dina intressen och prioriteringar i livet. Castra är en entreprenörsdriven konsultgrupp inom IT, management och systemutveckling. Bolaget ägs gemensamt av medarbetarna och tillsammans bygger vi det företag vi själva vill jobba på.


Vår vision är att vi ska vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för konsulter. Att vi blivit certifierade av Great Place to Work fem år i rad är ett bevis på våra höga mål kring företagskultur. title: Senior .NET/C#-utvecklare – Cloud, Containers & Modern Fullstack
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vårt körsbär på konsulttårtan är något annat. Sök jobbet och smaka själv!*

**Moderna .NET-ramverk** (t.ex. .NET 6/7/8, .NET Core)


**Cloud-lösningar** i Azure, AWS eller Google Cloud


**Containers & orkestrering** (Docker, Kubernetes)


**API-utveckling och integrationer** (REST, GraphQL, OpenAPI/Swagger)


**Databaser** (SQL, NoSQL)


**CI/CD-pipelines och DevOps-metodik**


**Fullstackutveckling** med moderna JavaScript-ramverk (Angular/Vue/React)


**Erfarenhet vi söker**


* Minst 8 års erfarenhet av C# och .NET-plattformen
* Stark kompetens inom moderna .NET-ramverk, t.ex. .NET Core
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar (Azure, AWS eller GCP)
* Vana av att bygga och konsumera RESTful API:er
* Erfarenhet av containerbaserade lösningar (Docker, Kubernetes)


Låter detta någorlunda som du? Tveka inte att höra va dig så tar vi en dialog redan kommande vecka!


**Bara det bästa åt de bästa – vår personalfilosofi**


Castra är en konsultgrupp inom IT och Management. Eller ja, en elite squad kan man säga. Vi samlar de vassaste och mest erfarna konsulterna, helt enkelt för att det är hos oss de får ut max i både kapacitet och livskvalitet. Vi är verksamma inom Systemutveckling, IT-infrastruktur, IT-styrning & Ledarskap samt IT-säkerhet.


Vi är en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, på riktigt! Det låter lite skrytsamt, men det är faktiskt inte vi som sagt det. Castra har sedan 2017 blivit certifierad av **Great Place to Work** och har de senaste två åren blivit utnämnda till **Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplats** för stora bolag. Som grädde på moset är vi även ett Gasell- och Karriärföretag.


På Castra tror vi på frihet, utveckling och gemenskap. Du som konsult styr själv vilka uppdrag du tar, när du jobbar, om du vill levla upp någon kompetens och hur och mycket lön och semester du tar ut. Att du får bygga din egen logga är bara en bonus! Trodde du det var allt? Då trodde du fel. Stöd av bra chefer, aktiviteter, kompetent och snabbfotad säljstyrka, möjlighet till delägarskap, stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets framtid och härliga kollegor – listan på vad som gör Castra till en fantastisk arbetsplats kan göras lååång. Möjligheterna bra nära oändliga. Win för alla parter, säger vi.

*Castra har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro, Jönköping och Sundsvall.*


Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss på castra.se/konsulterbjudande/

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?**


Sök direkt via länken eller hör av dig till Charlotta Ljung på Charlotta.Ljung@castra.se eller 072-871 63 12

title: Senior Frontendutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* minst 8 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av Angular2+
* språkanpassning i Angular där ett höger-till-vänster språk tex arabiska använts.
* Red Hat OpenShift.
* applikationsövervakning med AppDynamics och Kibana.
* .NET C#, ASP.NET WebAPI, .NET CORE.
* TypeScript, SASS, HTML5, Bootstrap.
* reaktiv programmering med RxJS
* att arbeta med git enligt GitFlow
* automatiserade byggen och automatiserad testning med Jenkins

  

**Meriterande*** Erfarenhet av integrationsutveckling i MuleSoft/Anypoint.
* Erfarenhet av testautomatisering med Jest, NUnit och Cypress.
* Erfarenhet av monorepos med Nx.
* Erfarenhet av tillgänglighetsanpassningar enligt WCAG 2.
* Erfarenhet av utvecklingsverktygen Visual Studio Code, Visual Studio (2017 eller senare), Fiddler och Postman.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Node.js och Python.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila team med Jira eller liknande verktyg.
* Erfarenhet av Behavior Driven Development.
* Erfarenhet av ServiceNow.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i komplexa utvecklingsmiljöer med många systemintegrationer.
* Erfarenhet av att leda och agera mentor till andra utvecklare eller hålla tekniska workshops inom systemutveckling.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom statlig eller annan offentlig/icke-vinstdrivande verksamhet.

  


  

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 02-12-2025

 **Om Oss**  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Product Developer - Technical Ware
description:
Since 2006, we’ve gone our own way. We love the products we co-create with our customers. It’s a dedication to exceptional quality in our products, as well as driving a great customer experience, that has led to the fact that you can find our two brands, Dope and Montec, on most slopes around the world. From one winter season to the next, we continually improve everything we do, and our products evolve alongside us and our customers.

**What’s this role about, then?**
  

**To start with**, you’ll dive into Ridestore, get to know your new teammates, understand what makes us unique, who’s who, what tools we use, explore our brands and products to grasp their current identities, where to get coffee, what kind of fabric the nerdy R&D guy is talking about… and… you get it; learn a lot about your new workplace.


Then, depending on your background and how fast you learn, we see you engaging in a variety of things in this role, some probably from day one, others way later:

* **Iterative product development:** You will continuously build and improve products over time, ensuring the creation of the best possible results while finding purpose and fulfillment.
* **Test new designs:** You’ll experiment with new ideas, identify design risks, and collaborate with the design team to make construction decisions that ensure quality and aesthetic alignment.
* **Own product improvements:** You’ll drive product enhancements and clearly communicate sample feedback to suppliers. You will suggest and test technical improvements, digging deep to understand why some constructions work and why others fail.
* **Enhance technical quality:** You'll contribute to building our quality by evaluating samples in detail and providing actionable feedback to our factories.
* **Optimize the product development team:** Support in building and refining ways of working that keep the team efficient and agile. You’ll be expected to bring a passion for improving how we approach product development.
* **Build technical assets:** Using Adobe Illustrator, you’ll create and maintain a high-quality tech drawing library for all products.
* **Stay on top of projects:** You’ll track project stages, prioritize urgent deliveries, and flag any potential delays.
* **Solve problems:** You’ll approach challenges with an open mind and creativity, driving solutions when issues arise.
* **Share knowledge:** We’re doing this together. You’ll leverage your technical expertise across the team and company to help people grow and gain a deeper understanding of our products.

**Sounds interesting, right?**
  

What you read is meant to help you understand what we envision you driving and achieving, so you know where to aim. As we grow and change, you and the team may realize that your role needs to adapt and evolve. We welcome change, so this list should help you understand our expectations without limiting the future you.


**You are…**

* A passionate product developer
* A sociable person, comfortable in both giving and receiving feedback
* Self-driven and detail-oriented
* Autonomous, capable of handling projects independently
* A structured mind that can keep projects on track
* A problem-solver to tackle the coming bumps in the road
* A humble person who knows how to laugh
* Someone who loves working in a team

  

**Your Experience**

* Experience in product development for functional outerwear
* Deep knowledge of Illustrator
* A clear understanding of lead times and product development processes


It's a full-time role based in our only office in Gothenburg. We would like you to live close to Gothenburg or relocate here so that you can work from the office approximately four days a week. Ridestore is distributed across several countries and has a great digital workplace, meaning we will also offer you the flexibility to work from home.


So, apply if you want to be part of a fun-loving and humble crew where we go our own way. Our journey is our goal; we want to continue learning and see where it takes us. We’ll offer you freedom in a passionate and somewhat snowy environment where you can impact the future of Ridestore with your work.

 **How we do it**


Please do not spend any effort writing a cover letter before applying. Instead, you will have the opportunity to write answers to some questions that we find interesting for this role. In this role, we're working with our favorite external recruiter, Lisa. If you have any questions, please reach out to her! Good luck, and have fun!

title: Partneruppdrag Prevas - iOS-utvecklare
description:
**Söker för kundspecifikt konsultuppdrag en iOS-utvecklare.**  



**Beskrivning**: *En beskrivning av kunden eller den bransch där kunden verkar. Det är onödigt att vara för specifik här.*


Till App teamet söker vi nu en apputvecklare med stora kunskaper inom iOS för att vidareutveckla appen. Vi alltså söker konslt som är en senior utvecklare och van vid att arbeta med både nyutveckling och förvaltning i befintlig arkitektur.


Du kommer vara en del av ett etablerat agilt team på ca 10 personer där vi har roller som produktägare, Android- samt iOS-utvecklare, testare, UX-designer, team coach och gruppchef.


Du kommer jobba nära en iOS-utvecklare i ditt team, där code review görs löpande som en del av arbetet. Utöver teamet samarbetar du även tvärfunktionellt med andra iOS-utvecklare inom IT-avdelningen på Trafikförvaltningen samt deltar i möten med intressenter från olika delar av organisationen.


Arbetsspråket är svenska, både i tal och skrift.  

  



**Kompetenskrav:**

* Senior inom iOS-utveckling minst 5 års erfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av att publicera iOS-applikationer för både ipad och iphone
* Erfarenhet av iOS-Applikationsutveckling för många användare >100 000
* Erfarenhet av Swift, SwiftUI  

Erfarenheten ska omfatta arbete med avancerade funktioner i Swift, såsom generics, felhantering (error handling), minneshantering (memory management), parallellprogrammering (concurrency) med async/await samt avancerad UI-komposition i SwiftUI.
* WCAG, VoiceOver  

Erfarenhet av att deltagit i minst två (2) projekt där tekniska lösningar direkt ledde till mätbara förbättringar, samt innehaft nyckelroll i minst ett projekt av dessa. Exempel på förbättringar kan vara minskad appladdningstid med minst 25%, gjorde 20% av appen helt tillgänglighetsanpassad enligt WCAG AA, ökad appstabilitet med minst 30% (minskning av crash rate), eller förbättrade användarbetyg med minst en hel poäng på appbutiker efter en uppdatering.
* Erfarenhet av par-programmering och code review
* Erfarenhet av att ha jobbat med Figma eller liknande designverktyg, tex Abstract, Sketch, Zepplin.

**Geografi**: *Stockholms*

**Uppdragslängd:**  

**Start:** 2026-01-12 **prelSlut:** 2027-01-08  

*100% ca 40h/vecka och på plats*


Sista ansökningsdag: *2025-11-30. Oftast är det bra att ligga steget före och vi presentera löpande bra CV:n för uppdragsgivaren före sista ansökningsdatum.*


Kontaktperson på Prevas: *Patrik Åkerlind*


Om du är intresserad av uppdraget visar du intresse genom att ansöka via knapparna nedan. Vi kommer inom kort höra av oss till de kandidater som är mest lämpade för uppdraget.


Processen för partneruppdrag går ofta snabbt så skicka din intresseanmälan så snart som möjligt.


Välkommen med din intresseanmälan!

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
**About Omda**


Omda is the Nordic region’s leading provider of specialized software solutions for healthcare and emergency care. Our mission is to give healthcare professionals innovative tools that improve patient outcomes and streamline workflows.

**About Omda Response**


Omda Response is a business unit within Omda, consisting of about 35 people who develop mission-critical software for ambulance services, emergency departments, and clinical decision support. Our solutions help doctors, nurses, and paramedics make fast, well-informed decisions that ultimately save lives.

**About the Role**


We are looking for an experienced and skilled Senior Backend Developer to join our team in Gothenburg. You will play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining scalable backend systems that power our emergency care solutions. This is a unique opportunity to work with technology that truly makes a difference in healthcare.

**Responsibilities**

* Design and implement robust backend services and APIs for emergency care applications
* Collaborate with frontend developers, product owners, and domain experts to deliver high-quality solutions
* Ensure system reliability, scalability, and performance
* Contribute to architectural decisions and technical strategy
* Maintain and improve existing codebases with a focus on quality and security
* Mentor junior developers and promote best practices in software development

**Requirements**

* Solid experience in backend development with .NET and C#
* Good understanding of React.js and how backend services integrate with modern frontend frameworks
* Hands-on experience with Jira, and working in Scrum or other agile methodologies
* Strong understanding of system architecture, microservices, and API design
* Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate in cross-functional teams
* Fluent in Swedish and English

 **Nice to have**

* Knowledge of healthcare interoperability standards such as HL7 FHIR, OpenEHR, and related data models
* Experience designing and building scalable EMR systems or other clinical applications
* Familiarity with cloud platforms like Azure and AWS, including deployment and monitoring tools

**We offer**

* A meaningful role in a company that improves emergency care in Sweden and the Nordics
* Hybrid model: 3 days at our Gothenburg office, 2 days remote
* Competitive salary and benefits
* Opportunities for professional development
* An inclusive and collaborative team culture

title: Core Network as a service Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


Ericsson's 5G core business is launching an innovative and highly dynamic unit that will change how we bring 5G solutions to the market, thus changing the way 5G core is delivered globally. We aim to build and deliver Cloud Native solutions “as a Service” on Hyper Cloud Providers (HCP).

  

You will have the opportunity to spearhead how the public cloud connects with core telco services and help build more elastic and fit-for-purpose capabilities, while venturing new business models. This will fundamentally change how we bring 5G services to the industry, making it more accessible, more versatile, and create new opportunities for innovation.

  

We will bring the standard methodologies of the SaaS industry in the public cloud to the realization of 5G services. We are looking for individuals who want to lead change in the industry, apply the latest technologies to a domain that society relies on day in and day out.

  

Come and join us and lead the industry change!

 **What you will do:**

* End-to-End Development: Drive the full lifecycle of our services, from crafting highly optimized code in Go and C/C++ to building comprehensive automated tests and robust deployment scripts.
* Architectural Excellence: Actively contribute to the design and implementation of secure, scalable, and highly reliable applications and services.
* Automated Delivery: Leverage and enhance our advanced Cloud-Native CI/CD pipelines to streamline and automate the entire software delivery process, from code commit to production.
* Operational Insight: Implement robust monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions to ensure the continuous reliability, availability, and optimal performance of our critical cloud-based applications.
* Innovation & Growth: Continuously learn and apply the latest trends and emerging technologies in cloud computing, actively sharing knowledge and contributing to the continuous growth of our company's technical expertise.
* Collaborative Impact: Thrive in a Lean, Agile, and DevSecOps environment, collaborating closely with your team members to deliver exceptional value to our customers.

 **The skills you bring:**

* Strong Programming Foundation: Strong proficiency in Go and C/C++, coupled with hands-on experience in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform.
* Cloud Native Mastery: Deep practical experience with cloud-native development principles and technologies, including Kubernetes, Docker, and microservices architecture.
* Public Cloud Expertise: Proven experience working with major public cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Amazon Web Services (AWS), or Microsoft Azure.
* Networking Acumen: A solid understanding of core network architecture, including experience with Network Function Virtualization (NFV) and Software-Defined Networking (SDN).
* Security First Mindset: Strong understanding and practical application of network security principles and best practices.
* DevOps & Automation: Hands-on experience with modern development platforms and CI/CD tooling, specifically GitHub and GitHub Actions.
* Collaborative Spirit: You thrive in a collaborative, generative team culture, actively supporting your teammates and prioritizing customer success.
* Problem Solver & Learner: A curious mind with exceptional problem-solving skills, a passion for continuous learning, and a creative approach to technical challenges.
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city: Göteborg or Stockholm**

**Req ID:** 775360

title: Software Developer (Stage 4) - Customer Initiative & Proof of Concept
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this Opportunity**  

  

We are looking for a curious and motivated Software Developer (Stage 4, newly graduate) to join a small, energetic team of young graduates. The team focuses on customer-facing initiatives: building proof-of-concepts (POCs), producing visualizations that demonstrate what our product can do, and delivering other special assignments that help win and shape customer engagements. This is a great opportunity to learn, get hands-on experience, and take part in delivering tangible demos used with real customers.  

  

You will be contributing to evolve of one of the world's largest fintech solutions, serving more than half a billion users, and help shape the future of financial services.

 **What you will do**  

  

* Build and deliver features and small components in Java (full‑stack) writing clean, maintainable code.
* Write unit tests and basic end‑to‑end tests; participate in testing and quality activities.
* Push changes to production under supervision, following review and delivery processes.
* Use version control tools and perform code reviews; actively participate in peer reviews to learn and improve.
* Collaborate with teammates, product owners, and customer‑facing colleagues to turn requirements into working demos and POCs.
* Follow secure coding practices and take on special assignments that accelerate customer understanding and product adoption.
 **The skills you bring**  

  

* You are at an early stage in your developer career and eager to learn and grow
* You have practical experience with Java backend and/or JavaScript.
* You are comfortable using version control tools such as GitHub and have experience with code review.
* You write and run unit tests and consider testing part of development.
* You care about code quality and are ready to learn how to address issues raised by static code analysis (e.g., Sonar).
* You work well in a small, collaborative team; you are curious, proactive and receptive to feedback.
 **Qualifications:**  

  

* MSc or BSc in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.
* Proficiency in Java, Microservices, Docker, Kubernetes, Agile and AI methodologies.
* Strong collaboration, knowledge-sharing, and teamwork.
**Application**  

**We look forward to your application with CV in English. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail. We target 60% work-from-office.**  

**Last day to apply: 5th of Dec 2025**

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: Backend/Cloud Developer
description:
**Do you like building backend solutions that don’t just work, but keep working - secure, scalable, and easy to live with? At Framna we’re looking for a Cloud Developer who’s curious about the full picture, from code to infrastructure, and who enjoys turning complexity into systems that just… run. You’ll be part of a team that builds things for the long term, where quality and stability matter just as much as speed, and where learning new skills is part of the everyday.**

**Become part of the team**
---------------------------


Framna partners with some of the world’s most ambitious brands, like Swish, SJ, Essity, and SEB, to create digital products that define markets and deliver real-world impact. We are now more than 600 people across ten studios, building apps used by millions every day.


Step into a team where no one builds alone. As our next Cloud Developer, you will join forces with designers, QA engineers, analysts, and product leads to take ideas from first sketch to live product. You will also plug into a cloud community across Framna - a group that loves to test new things, share what works, and keep exploring better ways to build.

**What you’ll do**
------------------


This role is about more than just keeping services running. You will be trusted with the whole journey - from setting up infrastructure to making sure it is secure, resilient, and performs at scale.


More specifically, you will:

* Develop and maintain backend and cloud systems at different scales.
* Build and operate infrastructure and applications, ensuring reliability and performance.
* Work with security, databases, and networking to make systems stable and robust. Some of the languages we use today are Kotlin, Java, Typescript, or C# (.NET).
* Collaborate closely with product teams, developers, and partners to design solutions that meet both technical and business needs.
* Contribute to shaping the team’s Site Reliability Engineering practices.
* Share knowledge with colleagues and potentially mentor other developers.

**Who you are**
---------------


We are not looking for someone who only wants to go deep on a single tech stack. We think you will feel at home here if you like breadth, enjoy learning, and get energy from solving real problems. You might recognise yourself if you:

* Are curious about the bigger picture, from code to infrastructure to operations.
* Take pride in quality and don’t take shortcuts that create problems later.
* Feel motivated by variety, and enjoy picking up new tools or skills when needed.
* Like collaborating with teammates and partners to build things that last.
* Are interested in developing your leadership qualities, whether through mentoring or taking the lead in projects.

**About Framna**
----------------


Framna means ‘to bring forward’ in Old Norse. And that is exactly what we do. We partner with industry leaders (and those about to be) to create excellent digital products that define markets, reshape industries, and deliver meaningful impact.


Born from the union of digital agencies Bontouch, Move, and Shape, Framna emerged from a strong, product-led culture. Today, over 600 of us collaborate across ten studios in Denmark, the Netherlands, Poland, Sweden, Switzerland, and the US.


Every day, millions of users around the world rely on the products we help shape. From seamless payments to daily commutes, from better health management to smarter shopping. Our work supports more than €150 million in daily transactions and consistently earns an average App Store rating of 4.5.


Together with some of the world’s most ambitious brands, including Essity, SJ, Swish, and SEB, we craft products that lead markets and push boundaries. Because when products win, businesses win. We call it Win by product.

**What you get**
----------------

* **A studio worth leaving home for.** Our Stockholm office is right in the middle of the city - a super cozy space where there’s always something happening, whether it’s a demo, a fika, or someone testing out a new idea. We mix that with the freedom to work from home when it makes sense, and hours that flex around real life.
* **A culture of curiosity.** On Fridays we have weekly demos, Wednesdays mean lunch-and-learns, and sometimes we throw ourselves into conceptathons just to see what happens. We gather for company conferences just to share ideas, and we take time to learn something new when needed.
* **The freedom to follow your “what if.”** We believe the best roles are shaped by the people in them. If you are curious about something, you will have the trust and space to chase it, and probably a few teammates who want to jump in with you.
* **Teammates who bring their whole selves.** Designers who doodle during standups, engineers who can’t resist showing off a clever hack, product leads who keep the energy up when things get tricky. Around here, people genuinely like sharing what they know and celebrating when someone tries something new.
* **And of course, the benefits you’d expect.** A generous wellness grant, top-up on your parental leave, occupational pension, and plenty more to make life outside of work easier.

**Our hiring process**
----------------------

* First interview with our recruiter, Josephine
* Case assignment
* Technical interview
* Final meeting

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Development at Nolimit City (part of Evolution AB) is a challenging and exciting role where you will be part of a team dedicated to creating solutions that redefine our industry. By working in small, highly collaborative teams, you and your team will have clear ownership of one of our most important new initiatives.
   

  

 At Nolimit City, we optimize for quality, fast flows, and iterative development with short feedback loops. We have a strong focus on end-to-end ownership, continuous improvement, monitoring, and experimentation. We strive to have teams that are inclusive, helpful, and have a strong sense of ownership for what they build. Our engineers make some of the most significant decisions for the company, and we are looking for open and curious developers. As part of the Nolimit City team, you will be part of one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and contribute to creating value for our players worldwide.
   

  

 We are expanding several of our engineering teams, including the team working on new initiatives with innovative products for our end users and work on our core products.
   

  

 Although we prefer that you're working on-site we also undertand that you have a life outside of work, meaning that working remote from time to time, leaving early, coming in late etc is not something unusual for us. A bit of a cliche; but we do in fact offer a great deal of freedom but with that comes responsibility.
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

* Own the product from start to finish. Decide how it is best built, tested, deployed, and monitored.
* Work with large-scale, highly available, and robust modern systems.
* Be an integral part of a team and its culture and ways of working.
* Work with automated deployment enabling release multiple times a day.
* Succeed, fail, and learn together with other competent and talented people. We believe in an environment that offers growth opportunities and see education as a result of failure that brings us closer to the next breakthrough.
* Take responsibility for system design, work together with domain architects, own end-to-end problems, manage stakeholder communication, and mentor junior engineers.


 Who you are
   

  

* Tech stack should include: JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js, React, Java.
* Experience with advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks
* Experience with APIs and product development
* A passion for writing clear and sustainable code
* Experience with agile methodologies, continuous integration, continuous delivery
* Good spoken and written English skills
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and takes ownership of the change from editor to production system
* We understand that you might not have experience in all the areas listed above, but as long as you have the ambition and willingness to learn we would like to hear from you.


 Some of our technologies
   

  

* Javascript / TypeScript
* React / NextJS
* Redux / Redux-Toolkit Query
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Node.js and Express.js
* Java 17, Dropwizard
* MySQL
* PostgreSQL
* AWS, Ubuntu, Docker, GitHub Actions


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
At Intric, we're on a mission to let everyone benefit from generative AI by making the creation and deployment of AI-based tools easy, open, and secure. Our collaborative web application is already a trusted resource within the Swedish public sector and we’ll now be entering a pivotal growth phase. Join us now and be a core part of our ambitious journey.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Frontend Engineer, you’ll lead the development of a fast, accessible and scalable web experience. Your work will range from building new features to refining our architecture, always with the end-user in focus. You'll collaborate closely with developers, product designers and business teams to continuously improve the platform across both desktop and mobile.
   

  

 Our tech stack consists of Node, TypeScript, HTML/CSS, Svelte/SvelteKit, Tailwind CSS. Infrastructure: Docker, Git, Jira
   

  

**The** 
**Team**
 You’ll be joining a cross-functional, fast-moving product team with a collaborative mindset. We keep processes lightweight and adapt as we go. You’ll have significant freedom to influence both technology and direction — and we value sharing, learning and pragmatic decisions above hierarchy or rigid frameworks.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 You have 3–5+ years of frontend engineering experience with a solid understanding of core web technologies (HTML/DOM, HTTP, JavaScript/TypeScript). Your experienced in building and scaling modern web applications and proficient in state management and caching (preferably in Svelte or similar frameworks).
   

  

 You can write efficient, maintainable, and accessible code with a collaborative mindset and strong communication skills.
   

  

 You might have a degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
   

  

 While not a must, experience with Svelte/SvelteKit and Tailwind CSS and familiarity with developer tooling and internal workflows is a plus.
   

  

**Perks**
* Flexible, trust-based work environment
* High degree of ownership and influence
* Work on meaningful technology with real societal impact
* A collaborative and curious team that values continuous learning

title: Mobile Developer
description:
**Job Description**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO​**




 As a Mobile Developer, you'll ensure seamless and engaging experiences across smartphones, PCs, and other devices. Experience with multiple device types, payments, and iOS is highly valued. While Kotlin is the main language, JavaScript and TypeScript are also useful. Your work will cover POS sales, payments, back-office applications, mobile payments, self-checkout stations, and standout in-store payment solutions.
   

  





**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**




 At Store Lens, we work closely with Portfolio Brands and H&M Brand to design and provide technical solutions. We contribute to product development at every stage, from setting requirements to rollout and testing. From day one, we focus on improving by listening, building, and refining as we go. Even as we define requirements, we are already thinking ahead, using early designs, first developments, and new learnings to continuously make the product better.
   

  





 We are curious, active listeners and hands-on doers.
   

  





 Beyond your work with Store Lens, you will also be part of our Engineering community, where you will have access to a network of experts, resources, and opportunities to grow.
   

  





**WHO YOU ARE​**




 We are looking for people with…​
   

  




* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience), and at least 5-8 years of experience as a Software Engineer with mobile and front end focus.
* Proficiency in Android development in Kotlin.
* Proficiency in build secure applications with Microsoft Login and Single Sign-On capabilities.
* Experience in mobile development for multiple devices.
* Experience Integrate hardware and communicate effectively with Android applications.
* Experience to work with SDKs from external vendors.
* Experience in Consume web services (e.g., REST APIs).
* Collaborate with UX/UI designers and utilize Figma for design implementation.
* Experience of CI/ CD pipelines using Azure DevOps / GitHub Actions.
* Knowledge and apply basic Mobile Device Management (MDM) principles (e.g., Airwatch).
* Experience in POS, Payment and Checkout area is a plus.
* IOS development, experience is a plus.
* Apply basic web development skills is a plus.



*And people who have* 
 :
   

  




* Continuous learning mindset to stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in backend testing.
* Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and communicate technical concepts clearly.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Experience conducting code reviews, identifying areas of improvement, and provide constructive feedback to maintain code quality and consistency.
* Familiarity in backend testing with a focus on ensuring the reliability and performance of backend systems.
* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development methodologies.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.



**WHO WE ARE** 
 ​
   

  





 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.​
   

  





 ​We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. ​
   

  





**​WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 
 ​
   

  





 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  





 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  





**JOIN US​** 
  

  





 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.​
   

  





 ​Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.​
   

  





 ​
 *\*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.​*

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Senior Optimizely Developer Opportunity in Stockholm** 




  





 I am looking for
 *Swedish speaking* 
 Optimizely Engineers in Stockholm to join a company focused on Microsoft C# & Optimizely development. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in developing Optimizely CMS and .NET solutions. Bonus points if you've worked as an architect or lead, or would like to take lead in technical decisions and road mapping.

* Build, design, and develop digital solutions using Optimizely CMS and C#/.NET.

* 5+ years' experience working with Optimizely
* Strong experience with C#/.NET

**Why Join?** 




  




* Chance to take ownership and make technical decisions that make a genuine impact on the project.

**Please apply via the Easy Apply function.** 




  





**For more information, please email l.letchford@tenthrevolution.com.** 




  





**The application deadline for this position is the 12th of December, 2025, however applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis so please apply quickly.**

title: 2x Backend developer
description:
We're looking for a backend-leaning engineer to join the ESP team. This role is ideal for someone with strong Java experience and a background in backend infrastructure. You'll be helping build and maintain systems that support internal editorial workflows used daily.
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

 Work on backend services written primarily in Java, including data pipelines and GraphQL interfaces
   

  

 Contribute to infrastructure improvements and maintain Postgres-backed systems
   

  

 Collaborate with teams working in both backend and frontend TypeScript (some frontend exposure is a plus)
   

  

 Build scalable systems that power internal tools used by editors, art directors, and product teams
   

  

 Help productionize features for tools with fast feedback loops from internal users
   

  

 Participate fully in team rituals and day-to-day collaboration
   

  

 What we're looking for
   

  

 Strong experience with Java and backend systems architecture
   

  

 Experience working with relational databases (especially PostgreSQL)
   

  

 Familiarity with GraphQL and TypeScript is a strong plus
   

  

 Comfort working across multiple systems and collaborating with frontend developers
   

  

 Bonus: experience working on publishing platforms or CMSs, or in environments where internal users are the primary customers
   

  

 How you work
   

  

 You’re a collaborative engineer who values communication and shared ownership
   

  

 You bring strong opinions, but hold them loosely
   

  

 You’re not afraid to speak up and are eager to bring people together around a shared idea
   

  

 This is a highly collaborative, cross-functional team with an emphasis on thoughtful engineering and empathetic teamwork. If you're excited about shipping internal tools that have real impact—and doing it alongside great people—we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

 Start/End Date: 2025-12-01 to 2026-06-30
   

  

 Workplace: remote Sweden

title: C# Developer
description:
**About MSAB** 




 At MSAB we write code that has real impact. We help law enforcement solve crimes, we fight corruption and protect communities. If that is what you want to do every day using your tech skills – then you are welcome to send your application!
 



  





 We are one of the world’s leading digital forensic companies, developing solutions for mobile device examination and analysis used by police, security agencies, and investigators across the globe. Here, your technical skills and innovative mindset will be challenged by real-world problems and the solutions you build will matter.
 



  





**Your role** 




 Working as C# developer you develop and maintain desktop applications in .Net environment. Your responsibility is to develop our graphical interface that makes investigators and forensic specialists work easier and more effective. This requires both skills in coding as well as understanding of GUI, writing automated tests and collaboration in agile ceremonies, standups and sprint planning.
 



  





 You will have significant impact in contributing to discussions about architectural issues and technical design decisions as an important part of our team.
 



  





**Our expectations** 




 We want to hear you tell us about your ability in writing clean and maintainable code, your experience from architectural design and your thoughts on working with both new as well as legacy code. The application handles data from all our teams in R&D and you will interact and collaborate with them to find solutions. To be successful in this role we believe you have an open-minded character, and we promise that your innovative mindset will be challenged by tackling complex problems to solve. An inspiring environment indeed!
 



  





 There is much more to say about our company culture, global reach, high tech environment, our growth plans and the possibility to contribute to creating a safer world. But we save that to the interview!
 



  





**You need to have EU- or Swedish work permit.** 




  





 For more information about MSAB, please visit: http://www.msab.com
 



 Ready to make your skills matter? Apply today and join us in shaping the future of digital forensics.
 



 Department Development Role C# Developer Locations Stockholm, Sweden Remote status Hybrid
