title: AWS Public Sector Associate Cloud Architect
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirement**
* This role requires you to be a Swedish National and have business level proficiency in the Swedish language


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


 A day in the life
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 1+ years of experience in cloud architecture and implementation and 1+ years of experience in consulting and working with customers
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* Experience with one of the following programming languages/technologies: Java, Python, Ruby, Node.js, C, or C++
* and experience or proficiency in DevOps, Cloud Infrastructure, AI, Security, Software Development or Databases would be highly desirable


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with one of the following programming languages/technologies: Java, Python, Ruby, Node.js, C, or C++ and experience with source control repositories (e.g. GitHub/GitLab, SVN, Mercurial, and Perforce)
* AWS experience preferred, with proficiency in a wide range of AWS services (e.g., EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, IAM, VPC, CloudFormation)
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A3118390

title: Master Data Senior Analyst – Procure to Pay
description:
Join AniCura as a Master Data Senior Analyst – Procure to Pay and play a key role in shaping data excellence across our European finance systems. You’ll drive automation, ensure data integrity, and help power our digital finance transformation in a collaborative, purpose-driven environment.
   

  

**About AniCura**
 AniCura is a family of well-known animal hospitals and clinics specialized in veterinary care for companion animals. AniCura provides modern, high-quality veterinary care for pets at over 500 practices in 17 European countries and creates peace of mind for pet owners through excellent access and patient safety. AniCura has a turnover of around $1B with the aspiration to expand business through a combination of organic growth and new hospital acquisitions. Every year, AniCura’s 12,000 passionate professionals attend to three million companion animal patients. Since 2018, AniCura has been a part of Mars Veterinary Health, a family-owned company focused on veterinary care.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 The Master Data Senior Analyst plays a pivotal role in maintaining data integrity and standardization across the Procure-to-Pay (P2P) function. Operating within a multinational, shared services environment, this role ensures the harmonization of master data across key platforms such as Oracle, APRO, ACIP, and Banking. By supporting seamless collaboration with our outsourcing partner (DXC) and enabling efficient, automated processes, the role underpins the operational effectiveness of the broader P2P landscape.
   

  

 As part of the European P2P structure, the Master Data Senior Analyst serves as a key liaison between operational teams, system owners, and DXC, ensuring that master data is optimized to support integration, accurate processing, and end-to-end process automation across markets.
   

  

 Reporting directly to the Head of P2P Europe, the role demands a blend of analytical expertise, meticulous attention to detail, and strong stakeholder engagement to drive data-driven excellence and continuous improvement.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the P2P master data domain, ensuring consistency, accuracy, and completeness across all relevant systems (Oracle, APRO, ACIP, Banking platforms).
* Design and implement data validation rules, quality controls, and governance frameworks to standardize processes across countries and legal entities.
* Collaborate with internal finance teams, IT, and DXC to ensure master data aligns with automation and integration requirements.
* Lead and Manage the compliance elements of our external outsource partner including ensuring compliance to SLA’s and contract specific requirements, including from time to time updates to the contract
* Review, manage, and apply internal controls across the full P2P process to ensure compliance with the Mars P2P guidelines
* Continuously improve master data maintenance processes to increase reliability, scalability, and audit readiness.
* Analyze existing data landscapes, identify discrepancies or inefficiencies, and lead harmonization efforts.
* Ensure timely and controlled master data changes with clear accountability and audit trails.
* Provide insights and reporting on data quality metrics, supporting the improvement of end-to-end P2P process performance.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders to promote adherence to data standards and foster a data-driven culture across the organization.


**Summary Of The Role**
* Job Title: Master Data Senior Analyst – Procure to Pay
* Department: Finance
* Reports To: Head of P2P Europe
* Location: Netherlands preferred, with flexibility for other AniCura locations across Europe.
* Contract: Full-time
* Languages: Fluency in English (additional European languages are a plus)
* Key Stakeholders: Finance Teams, IT, Outsourcing Partner (DXC), Local Market Operations


**Qualifications & Experience**
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in finance, Business Information Systems, Data Management, or a related discipline.
* Professional certifications in data management, governance, or ERP platforms (e.g., Oracle) are a strong advantage.
* Experience in managing external outsource partner relationships is a strong advantage.
* Minimum of 4 years of experience in a finance or data-centric role, preferably within a shared services or multinational organization.
* Demonstrated success in implementing master data governance frameworks and driving process standardization.
* Practical experience with ERP and financial systems—particularly Oracle—and familiarity with automation and digital finance tools.
* In-depth knowledge of Procure-to-Pay (P2P) processes and the critical role of master data quality in operational efficiency.
* Excellent interpersonal and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to influence cross-functional teams across Finance, IT, and third-party partners.


**Our offer:**
* Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to shape the future of veterinary care, together.
* An industry competitive salary and benefits package
* A stimulating work environment with good opportunities for personal development
* Freedom to take responsibility and the opportunity to influence
* Flexible working hours, hybrid working, international, digital work environment
* Learning and development opportunities
* The opportunity to cuddle our beloved 4-legged friends in our offices.
* We are always open for a conversation to discuss your individual needs.


**If this sounds like you**
 Please contact
 **Lekya Kanamarlapudi, Group Corporate Recruiter** 
 , who is happy to tell you more about this opportunity and the recruitment process. Or apply by submitting your resume through clicking the apply button below.
   

  

**AniCura is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from candidates with diverse backgrounds.**

title: Sales Manager
description:
**Job Summary**
**Job Description**
 Role: Sales Manager
   

  

 Division: Ticketmaster Sweden
   

  

 Location: Stockholm
   

  

 Contract Terms: Permanent
   

  

**THE JOB**
 In the role of Sales Manager, you will report to the Managing Director Sweden and lead the sales team, who will report directly to you. You will be part of the company’s commercial management team.
   

  

 This is a key position within Ticketmaster, where you are expected to be ambitious, results-driven, and focused on driving growth together with the sales team by signing new clients, ensuring Ticketmaster retains existing clients, helping them grow, and identifying new revenue streams in the market.
   

  

 In this role, you are expected to take responsibility for planning and executing the work needed to achieve the goals set by the company—both individually and by setting clear expectations for the sales team.
   

  

 You are expected to regularly represent Ticketmaster at events and industry forums to build networks and drive sales.
   

  

 Your naturally outgoing personality should always shine through, and you should have documented experience in new business sales with strong results, as well as leadership experience.
   

  

**You Are Expected To**
* Independently manage your own sales pipeline and ensure structured documentation of your contacts
* Be the first point of contact for our clients and collaborate with them to develop integrated concepts for their ticket sales, considering various systems, planned marketing activities, and pricing strategies
* Acquire new clients
* Identify potential new business opportunities
* Represent Ticketmaster through constant contact with new clients
* Help increase awareness of Ticketmaster and further strengthen our market position
* Monitor the event market and communicate new developments
* Act as the interface between company departments such as event services, marketing, product management, support, etc.
* Actively contribute to the sales strategy
* Lead and contribute to sales meetings
* Conduct regular 1:1 meetings with all members of the sales team to follow up and coach them
* Actively collaborate with regional sales
* Understand the sensitivity and confidentiality surrounding client information


**What You Will Be Doing**
* Build new client relationships and leads through meetings, regular phone calls, and other types of outreach
* Negotiate new agreements
* Demonstrate product knowledge to effectively present the company’s technology and services to both clients and colleagues
* Maintain ongoing business dialogues with clients regarding increasing Ticketmaster’s ticket volume, the client’s total ticket sales, and the sale of new services and products within the ticketing system (Microflex) or the e-commerce platform
* Create tailored sales and marketing materials for different target audiences
* Actively work on mapping Ticketmaster’s total client potential
* Collaborate closely with Client Support and other colleagues in the market as well as regional colleagues
* Continuously update client information and activities in Salesforce


**What You Need To Know**
* Experience in leading and engaging teams, including leadership roles with team members reporting directly to you
* Documented experience in sales. Experience in the ticketing industry or a similar field (established relationships with promoters, event organizers, and venue managers) is a plus
* Experience working in a fast-paced environment
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, with a proactive and logical approach
* Strong written and verbal communication skills; must be fluent in the local language and have strong English proficiency


**You (behavioral Requirements)**
 The following attributes are essential for success in the role:
   

  

* Self-motivated
* Ability to inspire confidence; quickly build and maintain strong working relationships with colleagues and clients
* Results- and delivery-focused
* Highly professional approach
* Strong business acumen
* Ability to take initiative independently
* Proactive nature, including a flexible approach to working hours


**LIFE AT TICKETMASTER**
 We are proud to be a part of Live Nation Entertainment, the world’s largest live entertainment company.
   

  

 Our vision at Ticketmaster is to connect people around the world to the live events they love. As the world’s largest ticket marketplace and the leading global provider of enterprise tools and services for the live entertainment business, we are uniquely positioned to successfully deliver on that vision.
   

  

 We do it all with an intense passion for Live and an inspiring and diverse culture driven by accessible leaders, attentive managers, and enthusiastic teams. If you’re passionate about live entertainment like we are, and you want to work at a company dedicated to helping millions of fans experience it, we want to hear from you.
   

  

**Our Work Is Guided By Our Values**
**Reliability** 
 – We understand that fans and clients rely on us to power their live event experiences, and we rely on each other to make it happen.
   

  

**Teamwork** 
 - We believe individual achievement pales in comparison to the level of success that can be achieved by a team
   

  

**Integrity** 
 – We are committed to the highest moral and ethical standards on behalf of the countless partners and stakeholders we represent
   

  

**Belonging** 
 - We are committed to building a culture in which all people can be their authentic selves, have an equal voice and opportunities to thrive
   

  

**EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES**
 We are passionate and committed to our people and go beyond the rhetoric of diversity and inclusion. You will be working in an inclusive environment and be encouraged to bring your whole self to work. We will do all that we can to help you successfully balance your work and homelife. As a growing business we will encourage you to develop your professional and personal aspirations, enjoy new experiences, and learn from the talented people you will be working with. It’s talent that matters to us and we encourage applications from people irrespective of their gender, race, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability status or caring responsibilities.

title: B2B Content Marketing Manager (Temporary Cover)
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, Paris, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.** 




  





 As a B2B Content Marketing Manager, you will play a crucial role in our global B2B marketing efforts, communicating our company's value to our key enterprise audiences. Your role will be to own our B2B content strategy and execution, elevating Epidemic Sound as a trusted voice in the industry. This is a temporary cover, expected to last approximately from January 2026 to January 2027.
 



  





 In this high-impact role, you will be the engine behind our B2B narrative, defining what we say and how we say it to key enterprise audiences. You will work cross-functionally to transform value propositions, product capabilities and business partnerships into compelling, high-quality content that drives awareness and enables our global sales teams. If you're a strategic content expert who thrives in a fast-paced environment and wants to own the voice for a rapidly scaling global business, this is the role for you.
 



  





**Your key responsibilities include:** 



* Owning and implementing the B2B content strategy and calendar from concept to execution.
* Developing and curating high-impact inspirational and educational content for various marketing channels, including customer success stories, blog articles, thought leadership, and webinars.
* Creating sales enablement assets and collateral to support our global enterprise teams.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams like PR, Music Curation, Product, and Sales to align efforts and develop strategic narratives.



  





**Requirements** 



* 6+ years of marketing experience with demonstrated expertise in B2B marketing.
* Proven ability to develop and execute comprehensive content marketing strategies that align with business objectives.
* Comfortable combining strategy and planning with hands-on execution.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work effectively across multiple teams and time zones.
* A strategic thinker who can interpret business needs and provide innovative solutions.
* A resourceful and adaptable mindset, comfortable with managing a diverse set of stakeholders.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and adjust strategies as needed.



  





**Nice to have** 



* Experience in a scale-up or fast-growing startup environment.
* Experience with managing agency relationships.



  





 Equal opportunity employer We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
 



  





 Application Ready to make the world feel your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.

title: Dynamics AX Functional Specialist
description:
TFS HealthScience is a leading global mid-size Contract Research Organization (CRO) that partners with biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies throughout their entire clinical development journey. Our expertise includes full service-capabilities, resourcing and Functional Service (FSP) solutions.
   

  

****Join Our Team as a****
****Dynamics AX Functional Specialist** 
 - home based in Sweden.**
**About This Role**
 As part of our
 **Information Technology** 
 team you will working alongside passionate and innovative professionals to ensure our customers achieve their goals.
   

  

 The
 ****Dynamics AX Functional Specialist****
 supports the TFS Microsoft Dynamics AX ERP system by gathering and evaluating user requirements, documenting business processes, and configuring DAX system. Ensure proper support of DAX system following Microsoft’s Sure Step methodology. ­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Provide application support to super users and end users of the TFS Microsoft Dynamics AX ERP system
* Review and highlight potential enhancements. Verify business needs, define and document user requirements, recommend solutions, and actively participate in implementation
* Perform gap analysis between package functionality and customer requirements. Identify and help design customizations, workaround, or enhancements required to meet customer needs
* Define, document, and analyse enhancement and bug fix requests following a formal change management process. Help system users and business owner to prioritize change requests
* Coordinate design workshops and create pilot / demo systems to match the customers’ expectations
* Assist with training of users on new processes and product
* Fulfil service requests and inquiries
* Maintain close working relationships with the internal business customer, IT teams, and external vendors to support DAX system
* Support existing integrations with other applications and recommend new integrations to improve efficiency and productivity


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree or above
* Minimum of 3 years of DAX functional specialist / consultant experience (full life cycle projects)


**Required Technical Skills**
* Dynamics AX 2012 R3 - Finance


**Desired Technical Skills**
* D365 Finance and Operations - Finance


**Required Personal Skills**
* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Clear communicator with excellent command of English - both oral and written
* Organized, methodical, and detailed oriented
* Quick and adaptable learner with excellent problem solving skills
* Self-motivated
* Team player
* Creative balanced with a thorough, investigative and analytical mind to systematically overcome obstacles
* Desire to improve with enthusiasm for expanding skill set


**Travel**
* Infrequent but occasional international travel


**What We Offer**
 We provide a competitive compensation package, comprehensive benefits, and the opportunity for personal and professional growth in a rewarding environment. You’ll be joining a team that values collaboration, innovation, and making a difference in the lives of patients
   

  

**A Bit More About Us**
 Our journey began over 29 years ago in Sweden, in the city of Lund. As a full-service, global Contract Research Organization (CRO), we build solution-driven teams working towards a healthier future. Bringing together over 800 professionals, TFS delivers tailored clinical research services in more than 40 countries with flexible clinical development and strategic resourcing solutions across key therapeutic areas including Dermatology, Neuroscience, Oncology and Ophthalmology.
   

  

 Our core values of Trust, Quality, Passion, Flexibility, and Sustainability are our guiding light serving as the framework for decision-making at all levels of the organization. They assist us in attracting and retaining valuable talent who share our sentiments, resulting in high employee engagement and satisfaction. By aligning on these fundamental values, we cultivate a unified force, geared towards innovation and excellence. This collective effort propels us towards our shared goal and fosters a culture of mutual respect and collaboration.
   

  

**Together we make a difference.**

title: Kommunikatör till RK Kommunikation, Regeringskansliet
description:
**RK Kommunikation, Förvaltningsavdelningen, Regeringskansliet**
 Vill du arbeta med kommunikationsfrågor i händelsernas centrum, där säkerhetspolitik, beredskap och krishantering möter kommunikationsstrategi? Vi söker nu en erfaren kommunikatör som vill bidra till att stärka Regeringskansliets kommunikation i en tid präglad av omvärldsförändringar och höga krav på samordning.
   

  

 RK Kommunikation ger kommunikationsstöd åt Statsrådsberedningen, departementen och Förvaltningsavdelningen. Vid avdelningen arbetar bland annat kommunikatörer, presskommunikatörer, brevhandläggare, grafiska formgivare, producenter, fotografer och filmare. RK Kommunikation arbetar både med det myndighetsövergripande kommunikativa stödet och med verksamhetsnära kommunikativt stöd i respektive departement.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.**
 Som kommunikatör arbetar du både operativt och strategiskt med kommunikationsstöd och rådgivning till politiska staber och sakverksamheter i frågor som rör säkerhetspolitik, allvarliga händelser och kriser. Du ansvarar för att ta fram kommunikationsplaner och strategier, skriva och samordna kommunikationsunderlag samt bidra till att utveckla och kvalitetssäkra Regeringskansliets kommunikation i dessa områden.
   

  

 Arbetet innebär också att du aktivt bevakar och analyserar omvärlden, hanterar mediefrågor och bistår i Regeringskansliets presstjänst. Du samverkar brett med olika funktioner inom Regeringskansliet och bidrar till att samordna kommunikation mellan departement.
   

  

 Läs mer om vår verksamhet på www.regeringen.se.
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 Vi söker dig som har en högskoleutbildning inom medie- och kommunikationsvetenskap eller annan utbildning och erfarenhet som Regeringskansliet bedömer som likvärdig. Du har minst fem års erfarenhet av både operativt och strategiskt kommunikationsarbete vid en större myndighet eller organisation. Du har även haft en rådgivande roll i strategiska kommunikationsfrågor och har minst tre års erfarenhet av pressarbete från större myndighet eller organisation.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har kunskap om beredskaps- och kriskommunikation samt säkerhetspolitiska frågor. God förståelse för hur man arbetar i en politiskt styrd organisation är också meriterande.
   

  

 Du är en skicklig skribent och har mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper**
 Regeringskansliets medarbetarkriterier är helhet, utveckling och resultat.
   

  

 Alla som arbetar i Regeringskansliet behöver ha helhetssyn och samarbeta för verksamhetens bästa. Du förväntas bidra med ditt perspektiv och din kompetens samt vara öppen för andras. Du kommer med idéer och nya angreppssätt för att förbättra och utveckla verksamheten och din egen kompetens. Du är inriktad på resultat i ditt agerande och anpassar dig när behov och inriktning ändras.
   

  

 Som person är du strukturerad och har god förmåga att snabbt växla mellan strategiskt och operativt arbete. Du är självständig, initiativtagande och har ett gott omdöme även i pressade situationer. Arbetet kräver att du är snabb, flexibel och har en väl utvecklad samarbetsförmåga.
   

  

 Läs mer på: Medarbetarskap och ledarskap i Regeringskansliet - Regeringen.se
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Tjänsten är en särskild visstidsanställning som sträcker sig till årsskiftet 2026. Den omfattar beredskapstjänstgöring och är placerad i säkerhetsklass, vilket innebär att en säkerhetsprövning kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas.
   

  

 Är du intresserad?
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om jobbet och vad vi erbjuder, kontakta enhetschef, Malin Nääs, du är också välkommen att kontakta Rekryteringsspecialist Daniel Leiva. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Johan Strokirk för Saco och Jan Wahlström för ST. Du når samtliga via Regeringskansliets växel, 08-405 10 00. Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Välkommen att registrera din ansökan i vårt rekryteringsverktyg senast den 10 december 2025.
   

  

 Regeringskansliet
   

  

 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar cirka 4 800 personer, varav omkring 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång, och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering.
   

  

 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering. Förvaltningsavdelningen ansvarar för myndighetsövergripande frågor som förändrings- och förnyelsearbete, ekonomi, arbetsgivarfrågor, kompetensförsörjning, kommunikation, säkerhet, it, bibliotek, arkiv och registratur samt för den gemensamma servicen i Regeringskansliet.

title: Lead Product Manager - Onboarding & Lifecycle
description:
**About Us** 




**At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.** 




 FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
 



  





 We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field.
 



**Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?** 




  





**The role** 




 We're looking for a Lead Product Manager to define and drive the strategy for our customer onboarding and lifecycle journeys. This is a high-impact role with a broad scope, focusing on front-end customer experiences.
 



 You'll be responsible for transforming and scaling our customer journeys to ensure we deliver the best product in the market, create smoother end-to-end experiences, and meet evolving business needs. Your focus areas will include registration, verification, login, customer communication, and account closure journeys.
 



 This is a critical role that sits at the intersection of product, engineering, data, compliance, commercial, and operational teams, requiring strategic vision, cross-functional leadership, and a strong sense of ownership.
 



  





**What you will do** 




**Define and Drive Product Strategy** 




 Set the strategic vision and direction for multiple products, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives, compliance needs and customer journeys.
 



**Own the Onboarding & Lifecycle Roadmap** 




 Develop and manage product roadmap, ensuring priorities reflect both long-term strategy and near-term impact.
 



**Decision-Making & Prioritization** 




 Lead complex prioritization discussions, balancing customer needs, business value and risk (including compliance), technical feasibility, and operational readiness.
 



**Data-Informed Decisions** 




 Promote and support a data-driven approach to product development, encouraging validation of ideas through metrics, experimentation, and continuous improvement.
 



**Coordinate Cross-Product Initiatives** 




 Oversee and align multiple product initiatives, ensuring consistency, collaboration, and efficient delivery within your team.
 



**Stakeholder Alignment** 




 Partner with senior leadership, commercial, compliance, engineering and operational teams to align product goals with company priorities. Act as a key voice in strategic discussions.
 



**Leadership and Mentorship** 




 Ensure your direct reports have appropriate training, tools and other resources to perform their jobs. Guide and mentor your team by providing feedback, sharing best practices, and supporting development.
 



**Own and Drive Product and Team Performance Through KPIs** 




 Define, track, and take ownership of the product and team's KPIs. Ensure targets are met or exceeded by aligning goals with strategic priorities, monitoring progress regularly, and driving accountability across the team.
 



  





 Compliance obligations:
 


* Ensure that you, and your team, adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations within your direct responsibility and control.
* Ensure any non-compliance incidents within your team are raised through the appropriate channels (Compliance Incidents Process) and that your team are informed of any reporting processes relevant to them.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Ensure your team's completion of all mandatory compliance trainings within the set deadline.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.



  





**How will success be measured in this role** 



* Acting in line with FDJ UNITED values
* Successful completion of all relevant training and other compliance activities that support FDJ's sustainable and responsible growth



  





**Your experience** 



* 1–2 years of experience as a Lead or Senior Product Manager, or 3–5 years as a Product Manager or Product Owner with a strong track record of ownership and delivery.
* Proven experience developing and executing product strategies and roadmaps across multiple initiatives, from concept through to launch.
* Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to manage competing priorities and align stakeholders across cross-functional teams.
* Experience in iGaming and their customer journeys is a strong asset.
* Experience operating within cross-functional organizations, collaborating closely with engineering, design, data, and business stakeholders.



  





**Our Way Of Working** 




 Our world is hybrid.
 



 A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
 



  





**Application Process** 




 We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.

title: Senior Backend Developer (Node.js)
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue, supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're looking for a Senior Backend Developer, who'll be a core member of our Card Services team, owning the systems that define the Qred VISA experience. Our mission is: solve complex cashflow problems for entrepreneurs, driving activation, retention, and massive transaction volume.
   

  

 Your work focuses on building highly resilient backend systems and scaling our product for new markets. You will drive key technical initiatives; from real-time payment features to personalized, data-driven loyalty programs. If you want high-impact ownership in a fast-moving, mission-critical domain, this is it.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Teamwork and collaboration: Work closely with the team’s developers, Tech Lead and Product Manager to find the best solutions and ensure we meet our goals.
* Test your own code: Take responsibility for the quality of your work by creating and running tests to ensure stability and functionality.
* Drive innovation: With a DevOps mindset, improve our workflows and contribute to the optimization of operations and delivery.
* Promote security and performance: Ensure our systems are secure and perform at their best, even as our user base grows rapidly.


**Requirements**
* Experience: Several years of experience in backend development with Node.js, and familiarity with modern workflows such as DevOps and Continuous Delivery.
* Relevant backend skills: A strong understanding of RESTful APIs and micro-service architecture.
* Cloud expertise: Experience working with cloud platforms. We use AWS, but its fine to have relevant knowledge from other cloud environments as well.
* Testing skills: Being comfortable writing and executing tests for your own code.
* Communicative and team-oriented mindset: You like working within a team, enjoy sharing knowledge and contribute to building a strong team spirit.
* Technical curiosity: You enjoy staying up to date on new technologies and tools in backend development.
* Language skills: Being comfortable using English as your working language and understanding the importance of clear communication in an international environment.


**We highly value**
* Cards and payments experience: If you have previously worked with credit cards, payments or transactions it’d be really valuable to us.


**Why join us?**
 This is the place to be if you’re looking for a place to grow. Qred is growing fast, and our Qredsters along with it. With a non-bureaucratic organization and delegated responsibilities, we make sure there’s a short path from idea to action. In addition to our great culture, you get to work with the latest cutting-edge techniques, responsibility for the whole development chain, and last but not least a bunch of great competent colleagues to learn from!
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in our headquarters in Stockholm. While we encourage a hybrid setup, we do expect you to be at least three days per week at the office. We review applications on a rolling basis and while the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Verksjurist
description:
Som verksjurist på vår rättsavdelning erbjuds du ett av Sveriges viktigaste juristjobb i vilket du varje dag kommer att bidra till Sveriges elförsörjning. Vi behöver dig för att lyckas med vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag att elektrifiera Sverige.
   

  

 Rättsavdelningen tillhör division gemensamma funktioner - en integrerad del av Svenska kraftnät som ska lösa de gemensamma utmaningarna. Gemensamma funktioner stöttar hela organisationen och jobbar dagligen för att förverkliga Svenska kraftnäts gemensamma mål.
   

  

 Gemensamma funktioner består av kommunikation, HR, rättsavdelning, inköp, säkerhet och beredskap, fastighet och hållbarhet.
   

  

 Vi behöver kreativa, innovativa förmågor med olika kompetenser
   

  

 – är du en av dem?
   

  

 Läs mer om vår arbetsplats här: Vår arbetsplats | Svenska kraftnät (svk.se)
   

  

 Ta chansen och sök till en av Sveriges viktigaste och mest spännande arbetsplatser!
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Vill du arbeta som verksjurist i en samhällsviktig verksamhet - i en utvecklande miljö med internationell koppling?
   

  

 Svenska kraftnät expanderar kraftigt på grund av en kombination av Sveriges energiomställning och ett kraftigt ökande behov av el vilket i sin tur involverar många marknadsaktörer och även medför en snabbt ökande internationell samverkan inom elsektorn. Vi stärker därför vår verksamhet med en verksjurist med inriktning mot att stötta verket i en rad olika frågor.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 Arbetet innebär att ge stöd till verksamheten med juridiska bedömningar inom i huvudsak ellagsområdet och den därtill hörande EU regleringen främst inom områdena drift och elmarknad. Arbetet innebär också att stötta verksamheten i rättsliga frågor som uppstår vid genomförandet av olika regleringar t.ex. vid beslut och avtal. Tillsammans med verksamheten ser du över vilka förändringar som kan behöva föreslås i olika författningar och tar fram och ser över mallar samt avtalsvillkor. Du ger stöd vid prövning enligt ellagen och EU förordningar och ditt arbete sker i nära samarbete med verksamheten. För att trivas i rollen är det viktigt att du är nyfiken och intresserad av att sätta dig in i nya frågeställningar.
   

  

 Utöver ellagsreglering kommer du i din roll få jobba brett med ett flertal olika regleringar, däribland, förvaltningsrätt, avtalsrätt och offentlighet och sekretess.
   

  

 Som verksjurist på Svenska kraftnät får du möjlighet att utveckla din förmåga att arbeta i gränssnittet mellan teknik och juridik, med strategiskt rättsliga frågeställningar. Som verksjurist arbetar du självständigt och har ett stort eget ansvar för de rättsliga frågor som du arbetar med. Du arbetar i nära samarbete med verksamheten. För att möta energiomställningen och klara samhällets elektrifiering utvecklas vår verksamhet snabbt. Du behöver ha viljan att hitta lämpliga lösningar även när juridiken är komplex eller svårtolkad.
   

  

 På Rättsavdelningen arbetar ett trettiotal verksjurister uppdelade på tre enheter , med bl.a. internationella frågor, IT-rätt, ellagstiftning, förvaltningsrätt, entreprenadrätt, avtalsrätt, upphandlingsjuridik samt arbetsrätt. Det dagliga arbetet sker i dialog med de delar av verksamheten som arbetar med aktuella frågeställningar och vi strävar efter att ge ett verksamhetsnära rättsligt stöd.
   

  

 Enheten för Systemjuridik arbetar bl. a med internationellt samarbete, drift- och elmarknadsfrågor, anslutningsfrågor och juridik avseende el, både EU-rätt och nationell rätt.
   

  

**Om dig**
**Skallkrav:**
 Utbildning.
   

  

 Du ska ha en svensk juristexamen eller jur.kand.examen.
   

  

 Vidare ska du ha:
   

  

* Minst fem års erfarenhet av rättsligt arbete från myndighet, advokatbyrå, företag eller organisation
* Erfarenhet av avtalsrättsligt arbete
* Erfarenhet av arbete med EU-rätt
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet av energibranschen
* Erfarenhet av tillämpning av juridiska regelverk inom ett tekniskt område
* Erfarenhet av arbete i offentlig verksamhet.


**Personliga egenskaper**
 För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du är strukturerad, arbetar enligt en tydlig processsamt organiserar och planerar ditt arbete väl. Vi ser även att du är stabil och hanterar stress på ett konstruktivt sätt.
   

  

 Dessutom ser vi att du är lösningsorienterad och hittar konstruktiva lösningar på uppkomna problem, analytisk samt ser logik och samband i komplex information eller miljö. Självklart är du sist men inte minst samarbetsorienterad, och hittar lösningar genom att prestigelöst fokusera på det gemensamma målet.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering lägger vi stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg.
* Resor kan förekomma i begränsad utsträckning.
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50%, när arbetet så tillåter.
* Sista ansökningsdag: 24 november 2025.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning utan provtjänstgöring.
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät


 För mer information är du välkommen att följande personer;
   

  

 Rekryterande chef, Tess Mercedez Svennebäck, tel.nr. 010-489 23 56.
   

  

 Ansvarig rekryterare, Lennart Jansson, tel.nr 010-350 91 49.
   

  

 Fackliga representanter.
   

  

 Erica Midfjäll, ST, tel. 010-475 87 31
   

  

 Annika Ingeborn, SACO, tel. 010-475 87 72
   

  

 Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se.
   

  

 Jobba här – bli en viktig del av vår energiframtid | Svenska kraftnät
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare i samband med rekrytering, vi har upphandlade avtal som gäller för Svenska kraftnät som statlig myndighet.
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät kan det vara ett krav på svenskt medborgarskap i vissa befattningar. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Customer Success Representative - Dutch Market
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for a Dutch-speaking Customer Success Representative to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The role of Customer Success Representative involves supporting our Dutch customers via all of our inbound contact channels, phone, chat, and email. You will resolve our customer's errands which will be broad and varied, it can be anything from technical support or questions about an ongoing loan application. You will take full ownership of the customer's onboarding process and sales funnel. Solve errands and drive customer satisfaction through excellent customer service.
   

  

 In this role, you will collaborate with colleagues within the Customer Service/Sales team as well as other stakeholders and departments to drive errand resolution. We have grown the Dutch Customer Success team immensely in the past years and also received our banking license at the end of 2023. Therefore, you will also have an impact on new routines and ways of working both internally and on how we operate towards our customers. In this role, you will be a part of a large and diverse team of 19 people that houses Underwriters, Customer Success, and Collection Agents among others. This role reports directly to one of the two Team Leads.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Manage inbound customer errands, via phone, chat, and email
* Take full ownership of the resolution and the customer-facing contact
* Collaborate with colleagues both within and outside the team to drive improvements


**Qualifications**
* Experience in customer service, preferably via phone and email
* Basic knowledge of financial products
* Proven capabilities in high customer satisfaction
* Strong sense of ownership & detail orientation
* Curiosity and a will to constantly want to improve
* Fluency in Dutch, both written and spoken
* Proficient in English, as it's our primary business language
* Experience from previous fintech and/or fast-growing companies is a plus


**One last thing - if you’re about to send in your application**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher in Epidemiology and Biostatistics
emails: bjorn.nordlund@ki.se, bjorn.nordlund@ki.se, karin.bjorstrom@ki.se, karin.bjorstrom@ki.se, john.inge.johnsen@ki.se, john.inge.johnsen@ki.se
description:
****Do you want to contribute to better health for all?****
 Health inequalities are clearly visible in both preventable and treatable diseases, where groups with higher socioeconomic status are more likely to adopt healthier lifestyles and more effective disease management. Healthcare face major challenges in measuring and addressing the impact of SES gradients on health outcomes and quality of care. Without robust and scalable tools to capture SES at the individual level, health systems struggle to address inequalities, advance scientific progress, and improve health for all. Simply put: we cannot manage or change what we cannot measure. The B. Nordlund research group is looking for a postdoctoral researcher who wants to develop and validate the first version of an socioeconomic metric, the Swedish HOUSES index, during a two year contract.
   

  

**Your mission**
 The overall aim of the research is to integrate individual-level socioeconomic status in order to improve risk stratification and enhance the performance of machine learning models for predicting asthma exacerbations. The hypothesis is that socioeconomic-informed machine learning models integrated with the home spirometry system will more effectively predikt asthma deteriorations and reduce disease burden, particularly among vulnerable patient groups.
   

  

 You will be responsible for defining key variables for the construction of the first version of the Swedish HOUSES index, based on housing-related variables. You will then link registry data to the PRISAAD project and validate the Swedish HOUSES index against classical SES indicators and health outcomes in asthma. You will also actively participate in an international collaboration between Karolinska Institutet, KTH- The Royal Institute of Technology and the Mayo Clinic, USA, as well as contribute to conducting a meta-analysis that combines the Swedish and U.S. HOUSES indices with associated health outcomes.
   

  

**Your profile**
 To be eligible for employment as a postdoctor, a PhD or a foreign degree deemed to be equivalent to a Swedish PhD is required. This eligibility requirement must be fulfilled at the latest at the time of the employment decision. Completion of your doctoral degree within the last three years is considered an advantage. If there are special reasons, your degree may have been completed earlier.
   

  

 Furthermore, it is an advantage if you have experience in registry research and biostatistics based on data from national Swedish registries.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 A creative and inspiring environment with wide-ranging expertise and interests. Karolinska Institutet is one of the world's leading medical universities. At Karolinska Institutet, we conduct successful medical research and hold the largest range of medical education in Sweden. At KI, you get to meet researchers working with a wide range of specialisms and methods, giving you ample opportunity to exchange knowledge and experience with the various scientific fields within medicine and health. It is the crossover collaborations, which have pushed KI to where it is today, at the forefront of global research. Several of the people you meet in healthcare are educated at KI. A close relationship with the health care providers is important for creating groundbreaking top quality education and research. Karolinska Institutet is also a state university, which entitles you to several benefits through our collective agreement.
   

  

**Location:** 
*Solna*
 The B. Nordlund research group is a clinically oriented team that combines clinical epidemiological research with digital innovation and machine learning. The goal is for the research to play a key role in bridging scientific findings and technology with clinical implementation, ultimately improving healthcare—particularly in the fields of asthma and allergy.
   

  

 Link to the research group’s webpage at the Department of Women’s and Children’s Health (KBH): PANDA
   

  

**Application**
 An employment application must contain the following documents in English or Swedish:
   

  

* PhD certificate
* A complete resumé, including date of the thesis defence, title of the thesis, previous academic positions, academic title, current position, academic distinctions, and committee work
* A complete list of publications
* A summary of current work (no more than one page)


 Welcome to apply at the latest 15th of December 2025.
   

  

 The application is to be submitted through the Varbi recruitment system.
   

  

 Permanent position is initiated by a six months trial period.
   

  

**Want to make a difference? Join us and contribute to better health for all!**
 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: STÖD 2-4626/2025 | Kontakt: Björn Nordlund, adjungerad lektor bjorn.nordlund@ki.se, Björn Nordlund, adjungerad lektor bjorn.nordlund@ki.se, Karin Björström, HR-partner karin.bjorstrom@ki.se, Karin Björström, HR-partner karin.bjorstrom@ki.se, | Facklig företrädare: John Inge Johnsen , SACO john.inge.johnsen@ki.se, John Inge Johnsen , SACO john.inge.johnsen@ki.se, Bodil Moberg , ST-OFR 08-52483601, Bodil Moberg , ST-OFR 08-52483601, Elisabeth Valenzuela, SEKO 08-52486363, Elisabeth Valenzuela, SEKO 08-52486363, | Publicerat: 2025-11-21 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-15

title: Vi söker en Serviceingenjör inom fastighetsautomation till vårt distrikt Norra Svealand
description:
Låt ditt intresse för dagens och framtidens tekniska funktioner bidra till en hållbar värld! Transform the everyday with us.
   

  

 Vill du bidra till säkra och energieffektiva lösningar för fastigheter och arbeta i ett team med målsättningen att leverera högkvalitativa produkter och tjänster? Vi på Siemens Smart Infrastructure kombinerar den fysiska och digitala världen för energisystem, byggnader och industrier.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Här arbetar du med fastighetsautomation för att skapa hållbara och lönsamma byggnader.
   

  

 Rollen innebär nära samarbete med kunder för att förbättra deras anläggningar inom hållbarhet, teknik och digitalisering. Du lyssnar på kundens behov och föreslår värdefulla lösningar som bidrar till deras utveckling och maximerar byggnadernas potential.
   

  

 Som ny hos oss välkomnas du med ett introduktionsprogram av utbildningar, en handledare som ger dig vägledning och engagerade kollegor.
   

  

 Du blir expert på våra system och rådger kunder om nya digitala tjänster. Du utvecklar kundrelationer tillsammans med tekniker, projektledare och säljare i vårt lokala team.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 För att trivas i rollen är du en person som gillar att ta eget ansvar. Du trivs med kundkontakt och känner ett genuint intresse för att leverera en god service och att hjälpa kunder att utvecklas inom den senaste tekniken. Du är bra på att planera och prioritera, och du vill bidra till ett positivt arbetsklimat där teamet stöttar varandra.
   

  

**Vem är du**
 Du är en person som gillar att ta eget ansvar, trivs med kundkontakt och vill leverera god service. Du är bra på att planera, prioritera och bidra till ett positivt arbetsklimat.
   

  

**Vad behöver du?**
* Bakgrund inom el, gärna automation eller styr-/reglersystem
* Erfarenhet av fastighetsautomation
* Förmåga att förstå kundens behov och presentera kreativa lösningar
* Självständig problemlösning inom ditt kompetensområde
* Goda IT-kunskaper och förståelse för systemsamband
* Svenska och engelska språkkunskaper
* Körkort och svenskt medborgarskap


 Om du inte uppfyller allt ovan, men en del, uppmuntrar vi dig att söka tjänsten ändå. Låt oss tillsammans ta reda på om vi passar ihop! Viktigast är ditt tekniska intresse, ett praktiskt handlag och din inställning att sätta kunden först samt en nyfikenhet på digitaliseringens möjligheter.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 Vi erbjuder en flexibel arbetsplats med hög grad av frihet och ansvar över din vardag. Flexibiliteten ger våra medarbetare möjlighet att skapa en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Självklart finns också förmåner såsom friskvårdsbidrag, arbetstidsförkortning och tjänstebil.
   

  

**Ansök idag!**
 Sista ansökningsdag är
 **14:e December.** 
 Rekryteringen sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdagen. Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef jack.good@siemens.com. För information om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryterare lotta.lehmusvuori@siemens.com. För kontakt med facklig representant mejla facket.se@siemens.com. Då vi arbetar inom säkerhetsbranschen begär vi utdrag från Rikspolisstyrelsens misstanke- och belastningsregister vid potentiell anställning.
   

  

**Jonas Matkala Nordlund med personal önskar dig välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Om oss**
 Siemens erbjuder spännande utmaningar och karriärmöjligheter i ett innovativt, globalt företag i framkant av grön teknik. Vår arbetsmiljö är öppen, inspirerande och internationell och vi ger stora möjligheter till personlig och professionell utveckling. På Siemens finns en uttalad och väl etablerad policy som stödjer mångfald på arbetsplatsen. Hållbarhet är en integrerad del av vår verksamhet och vi har högt ställda mål och ambitioner. Våra teknologier och lösningar bidrar till att våra kunder kan nå deras hållbarhetsmål och ställa om sina verksamheter mot en mer hållbar framtid. Läs mer på siemens.se

title: Professor in Complex socio-technical systems with focus on transport
description:
Subject field
   

  

 Complex socio-technical systems with focus on transport.
   

  

 Subject description
   

  

 The subject field encompasses the development of knowledge, principles, methods, and tools that support the analysis and governance of complex socio-technical systems and their long-term development, with particular focus on sustainable transport systems.
   

  

 It builds on extensive model-based development and analysis of complex socio-technical systems including full life cycle characterization, integration of qualitative and quantitative methods, and tying in diverse perspectives, methods, and sustainability-related challenges. A central aspect of the subject field is a profound understanding on how different actors—through their perspectives, roles, and capabilities—shape and influence system changes, as well as how external factors drive development. Close collaboration with industry and other societal stakeholders is therefore a hallmark of the subject field.
   

  

 Duties
   

  

 The duties include both research and teaching. Research activities comprise conducting independent research, initiating new research directions, preparing research grant applications, establishing new research collaborations, and supervising students.
   

  

 The role also involves building, leading, and developing the research area of complex socio-technical systems at KTH. Research will largely be carried out in interdisciplinary projects, in collaboration with a wide range of stakeholders. The professor will be part of a multidisciplinary group, thematically organized at KTH, with responsibility for broadly advancing the subject area in collaboration with groups in areas such as systems and component design, mechatronics and embedded systems, integrated product development, and design. The interdisciplinary character of the subject also entails extensive collaboration with other departments and schools at KTH, as well as with industry and the public sector.
   

  

 The duties further include contributing to, and actively working to develop, education at first, second, and third cycles. This also includes responsibility for courses and course development. The professor is expected to be able to teach in Swedish within five years. If necessary, a language development plan will be established as support at the time of appointment.
   

  

 Eligibility
   

  

 A person who has demonstrated both scientific and pedagogical expertise are eligible to be appointed as a professor.
   

  

 Assessment criteria
   

  

 The assessment criteria for appointment as a professor at KTH shall be the degree of expertise required as a qualification for employment. In addition, the assessment criteria stated in the KTH appointments procedure, section 1.1, apply in relation to the employment profile laid down.
   

  

**Of
 *highest importance* 
 is that the applicant has**
* scientific expertise in the subject field.
* documented experience of cooperation with the outside community for mutual exchange and having acted to ensure the knowledge and skills at the university benefit society.
* pedagogical expertise in the subject field
* expertise in promoting the development of, and leading, activities and staff. For that purpose, the individual is to be knowledgeable about diversity and equal opportunity issues, particularly gender equality.


**Of
 *second highest importance* 
 that the applicant has**
* ability to collaborate.


**It is
 *also important* 
 that the applicant has**
* administrative expertise


 Trade union representatives
   

  

 Contact information to trade union representatives can be found at KTH's webpage.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Your application should follow KTH's CV template for employment of teachers. It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure that the application is complete according to the requirements in the ad and CV template.
   

  

 Your complete application must be received at KTH no later than the last day of application, midnight CET/CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

 Log into KTH's recruitment system in order to apply to this position online.
   

  

 For more information regarding KTH's assessement, see Appointments procedure at the Royal Institute of Technology
   

  

**Other**
 Striving towards gender equality, diversity and equal conditions is both a question of quality for KTH and a given part of our values.
   

  

 For information about processing of personal data in the recruitment process please read here.
   

  

 It may be the case that a position at KTH is classified as a security-sensitive role in accordance with the Protective Security Act (2018:585). If this applies to the specific position, a security clearance will be conducted for the applicant in accordance with the same law with the applicant's consent. In such cases, a prerequisite for employment is that the applicant is approved following the security clearance.
   

  

 Guidance on relocating and settling in at KTH and in Sweden.
   

  

 We firmly decline all contact with staffing and recruitment agencies and job ad salespersons.
   

  

 Disclaimer: In case of discrepancy between the Swedish original and the English translation of the job announcement, the Swedish version takes precedence.
   

  

 Join us at KTHKTH shapes the future through education, research and innovation. As a leading international technical university, we play an active role in advancing the transition towards a sustainable society. At KTH, you have the opportunity to grow and develop in a creative and dynamic environment, with good working conditions and attractive benefits. Equality, diversity and equal opportunities are essential to quality and form an integral part of KTH’s core values as a university and public authority. Learn more about our benefits and what it's like to work and grow at KTH

title: Senior AWS Public Sector Cloud Architect
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirement**
* This role requires you to be a Swedish National and have business level proficiency in the Swedish language


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


 A day in the life
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 7+ years of experience in hands-on cloud enterprise architecture design, storage and networking solutions
* 5+ years of experience in consulting and working with enterprise customers
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of experience in working with enterprise customers in building, migrating and modernizing enterprise applications
* 5+ years of experience with customer cloud transformation activities to ensure successful delivery of solutions


**Preferred Qualifications**
* AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) preferred and experience with automation and scripting (e.g., Terraform, Python, CDK, shell, Ruby, Powershell)
* Knowledge of security and compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR)
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Experience with AWS services (e.g. AWS Application Migration Service (MGN), Cloud Migration Factory, Portfolio analysis tooling) and managing large scale data center to data center and/or data center to cloud migrations; data center operations (e.g. data assurance, monitoring, alerting and notifications)
* Experience integrating AWS AI/ML services (SageMaker, Bedrock, Amazon Q); understanding of AI/ML governance and responsible AI practices


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
