title: Cloud Architect Azure
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**Vill du arbeta på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser?**
 Sopra Steria, Nordens ledande företag inom digital transformation, söker en erfaren och kompetent Cloud Architect inom Azure med dokumenterad erfarenhet för att stärka vårt framstående team. Vi har blivit erkända som Karriärföretag och en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser 2024 av Great Place to Work. I denna roll kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i leveransen av innovativa molnbaserade projekt till våra kunder samt bidra till vidareutvecklingen av vårt framstående molnerbjudande
   

  

**Som arkitektkonsult inom Azure kommer du att:**
* Delta aktivt i planering, design och implementation av Azure-lösningar för våra kunder.
* Operativt arbeta med lösningar som omfattar hela bredden av Azure-plattformen, inklusive IaaS och PaaS, med fokus på Entra ID för identitets- och åtkomststyrning.
* Coacha och vägleda kunder om optimal användning av moln- och hybridteknologi för att implementera nya lösningar eller migrera befintliga tjänster till Azure.
* Fungera som ämnesexpert som stödjer flera team eller som teknisk teamledare med övergripande ansvar för leveransen.


**För att lyckas med detta tror vi att du:**
* 5 till 8 års dokumenterad erfarenhet som Azure-arkitekt med stark tekniskt fokus och problemlösningsförmåga.
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Förmåga att automatisera och optimera arbetsflöden.
* Erfarenhet av att översätta kundens behov till konkreta designförslag och implementeringar.
* Erfarenhet från konsultbranschen med förmåga att arbeta i både stora och små team.


**Kvalifikationer och färdigheter:**
* Erfarenhet av design och implementering av lösningar i det publika molnet, med fokus på kostnadsoptimering, säkerhet, skalbarhet, prestanda och tillgänglighet.
* Kompetens inom programmerings- och/eller skriptspråk (Powershell, Bash, Python etc.).
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-verktyg som Azure DevOps eller GitHub.
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code (ARM, Bicep, Terraform etc.).
* Förståelse och erfarenhet av ramverk som Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework, Security Adoption Framework samt Well-Architected Framework
* Kunskap inom molnsäkerhet och Zero Trust arkitektur.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av containerlösningar som Docker och Kubernetes är meriterande.


**Om Sopra Steria:**
 Sopra Steria är en global aktör inom digital transformation med över 50 000 medarbetare i över 30 länder, varav 600 i Sverige. Vi har blivit rankade som en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser 2024 av Great Place to Work och är ett av topp fem bolag inom Digital Transformation enligt Gartner. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande och skicklig arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att vässa dina kunskaper och arbeta med branschens mest spännande projekt. Vi står nu inför en spännande tillväxtresa som genomsyrar hela verksamheten där det finns stora möjligheter att växa tillsammans med bolaget och skapa verklig förändring genom digital utveckling.
   

  

 Har du fler frågor? Om du har några fler frågor angående tjänsten får du gärna höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare Teodor Nellvik (teodor.nellvik@soprasteria.com).
   

  

 På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Sopra Steria tar inte emot CV:n från företag som vi inte har ramavtal tillsammans med. Vi tar inte ansvar för eventuella avgifter på CV:n som skickas oönskat till oss. To all recruitment agencies without a base agreement: Sopra Steria does not accept resumes from agencies with whom we do not have an agreement. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Sopra Steria employees or any other company location. Sopra Steria is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
*Redpill Linpro är ledande specialister inom open source och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle. Tillsammans samverkar vi för att uppnå maximal nytta för alla. Hos oss finns några av marknadens främsta experter inom sina specialområden. Vi är omkring 320 anställda och du finner oss i tre länder på åtta kontor: Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlstad, Linköping, Köpenhamn, Århus, Oslo och Trondheim.*
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Vi söker erfarna DevOps-utvecklare som vill stötta upp våra team och arbeta i en av Nordens tyngsta Linux-miljöer. Tillsammans med riktig vassa kollegor kommer du ta del av spännande kundprojekt och utveckla framtidens lösningar. För dig som har erfarenhet av, eller ett intresse för att utvecklas in i en ledande roll och driva team framåt så erbjuds även denna möjlighet
   

  

**Du kommer exempelvis arbeta med:**
* Systemdrift, arkitektur och code review
* Automatisera arbetsflöden med CI/CD i Git och Jenkins
* Containerteknologer såsom Docker, Kubernetes och OpenShift
* Molnbaserade lösningar såsom AWS, Azure eller OpenStack
* Scriptspråk så som shell script, Ruby och Python
* PostgreSQL/MySQL, Nginx, Varnish och Apache
* Konfigurering i Puppet och Ansible


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas som konsult hos oss har du ett stort teknikintresse och en vilja att utvecklas inom nya områden och i ny teknik. Du drivs av problemlösning och förstår att det är samarbete som för oss framåt.
   

  

**Utöver ovanstående kompetenser ser vi att du har:**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom relaterat område
* Flera års erfarenhet av DevOps-utveckling
* Erfarenhet av en eller flera av ovanstående teknologier
* Du har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


**Meriterande:**
* Vi ser gärna att du har en bred Linux-grund och har labbat runt med flera distributörer
* Erfarenhet av automatisering och/eller Cloud
* Erfarenhet av infrastruktur som kod (IaC) och GitOps


**Varför Redpill Linpro?**
* Du får arbeta med några av de allra mest begåvade IT-talangerna i en organisation som brinner för professionella Open Source-ideal
* Du får arbeta med spännande projekt i flera olika branscher: allt från startups till globala jättar och myndigheter där du får vara med och göra skillnad på riktigt!
* Du får trevliga chefer som för en bra personalpolitik - våra konsulter är våra superstars och prioriteras alltid först
* Du får arbeta med den senaste tech-stacken och alltid vara up-to-date med ny teknologi
* Du får ta del av fördelarna att arbeta på ett medelstort nordiskt bolag med go sammanhållning, bra förmåner och där du ges stor frihet och flexibilitet i ditt arbete


 Önskar du att bli en del av vårt team? Tveka inte att höra av dig. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in seven offices with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Integration DevOps Specialist
description:
This is an extraordinary opportunity to join the world’s leading exchange and market technology company as an Integration DevOps Specialist in the Nasdaq Packaged CCP (NPCCP) Team.
   

  

 You will be part of a team responsible for delivering a highly sophisticated Central Counterparty Clearing (CCP) system to major clearinghouses around the world. You will specifically be involved in the development of the frontend subsystems with ownership over the clearing operations application. NPCCP is an advanced system with very high demands on quality and performance and it is built with leading-edge Java technology and tools. You will work in a cross-functional scrum team consisting of Business Analysts, Software Developers and Testers.
   

  

 As an Integration DevOps Specialist, you will test, build, and maintain integration between NPCCP Product and other Nasdaq Post-Trade Solutions, reviewing business requirements and software design specifications. You will be responsible for designing and developing the automated testing tools, executing manual tests, and supporting System Integration Tests both remotely and at Customers location. This position is an exciting opportunity to develop your personal, technical, and leadership skills while gaining extensive knowledge of the exchange and post-trade industry in general and the CCP domain.
   

  

 We are looking for Someone With:
   

  

* University degree in computer science, information technology, software development or similar or equivalent work experience
* Some relevant work experience is preferred


 Skills, Requirements and Competencies:
   

  

* Knowledge of Linux
* Basic database skills (including simple scripts)
* Experience working with Git
* Experience working in Java development


 It would good if you have:
   

  

* Experience in FinTech industry
* Basic knowledge of Perl/python


 To be a good match for this role you should have an agile mindset and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. In addition, you should possess a strong drive to develop and achieve results, be a good team member and be able to work efficiently both independently and in cooperation with others.
   

  

 We offer an opportunity to develop in the financial domain at the same time as utilizing your knowledge and passion as well as work within a fast-paced organization where your work can really have an impact.
   

  

**What We Offer!**
* Annual monetary bonus
* An opportunity to become a Nasdaq shareholder
* Employee Stock Purchase Program Nasdaq stocks with a discount
* Flexible health insurance program
* Flexible working schedule and hybrid way of work
* Additional paid leave days after 2 years of working at Nasdaq
* Flex day program (up to 6 days a year)
* Internal mentorship program – get a mentor or become one
* Wide selection of online learning resources, e.g., Udemy.


**Does this sound like you?**
 This is a full-time permanent position located in Stockholm, Sweden. Nasdaq offers you a hybrid workplace to find a balance between working from home and collaborating in the office, therefore it's required to come into the office at least 3 days per week.
   

  

 Desired start date is as soon as possible. As the selection and interview process is ongoing, please submit your application in English as soon as possible.
   

  

**Come as You Are**
**Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.**
**We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.**

title: Founding Engineer
description:
**Noru** 
  is building the 
 **trust and resilience layer** 
  for IT-driven companies, turning the complex, costly, and static world of Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) into a living, continuous, and automated system. Our 
 **Vision** 
  is to empower every company to operate securely, resiliently, and with trust — by design.
 



  





 We have already secured our 
 **first customers — even pre-launch** 
 , with strong demand and real-world validation of our approach. The market is shifting fast, and Noru is at the center of that transformation.
 



  





 We are now hiring our first 
 **Founding Engineer** 
  — a rare opportunity to join the core team and take complete technical ownership of the platform and the AI intelligence layer. This role is for a 
 **builder** 
 , not a theorist: someone who turns ambiguity into production systems and learns by doing.
 



  




 Tasks
 
 As a Founding Engineer, you will have end-to-end responsibility for the most critical technical components of the Noru platform. Your main responsibilities and typical tasks will include:
 


* **Architect & Productionize Core AI:** 
  Design, build, and deploy our primary AI systems and LLM workflows that ingest vast amounts of corporate data (logs, configurations, policies) to perform continuous security and trust validation.
* **Foundational Platform Decisions:** 
  Establish the core technical architecture (data models, infrastructure, services) that ensures maximum scalability, security, and low-latency performance for real-time GRC monitoring.
* **Full-Stack Engineering:** 
  Own the implementation across the entire stack—from developing robust data ingestion pipelines in the backend to designing intuitive user interfaces in the front-end that present continuous trust insights.
* **System Integration:** 
  Develop secure, reliable integration frameworks to connect Noru with diverse enterprise systems (SSO, cloud environments, version control, ticketing systems) to establish a truly "living" GRC platform.
* **Pioneering Automation:** 
  Translate complex security and compliance standards (e.g., ISO, SOC 2) into elegant, automated, and continuously running validation logic, fulfilling our mission to 
 **prove compliance automatically.**
* **Shape the Product With Us:** 
  Work closely with the founders and early customers to rapidly iterate based on feedback and emerging needs.



  




 Requirements
 
 We prioritize talent, drive, and demonstrated ability over years of experience. We seek an engineer with exceptional intelligence, high agency, and the "hungry" ambition to build difficult things that matter.
 



**You likely demonstrate this through a combination of the following:** 



* **Proven Track Record:** 
  You have a history of successfully building, shipping, and scaling complex software systems, evidenced by strong professional experience, impactful personal projects, or an elite academic background.
* **AI/LLM Proficiency:** 
  Direct, hands-on experience building production-grade, data-driven applications utilizing large language models (LLMs), natural language processing (NLP), or complex data processing pipelines.
* **First-Principles Thinking:** 
  You are a critical and rapid learner who doesn't wait for specifications. You can identify ambiguous business problems, design robust technical solutions from the ground up, and execute independently.
* **Technical Fluency:** 
  Comfort and proficiency with modern, full-stack development, and experience with modern cloud environments (GCP, AWS, or Azure).
* **Domain Passion:** 
  A deep interest in cybersecurity, IT resilience, compliance (GRC), or a rapid willingness to master this complex and crucial domain.



  




 Benefits
 
 Working as a Founding Engineer at Noru is about maximizing your impact and accelerating your career trajectory:
 


* **Founding Equity:** 
  Meaningful option package aligned with Noru’s long-term success.
* **Clear Path to Leadership:** 
  This role is the clear and immediate path to becoming our Head of Engineering, VP of Engineering or even CTO as we scale, with massive organizational responsibility.
* **Build the Future Stack:** 
  The opportunity to make all foundational technical decisions with a clean slate, free from legacy debt.
* **Meaningful Mission:** 
  Build a product that genuinely helps companies reduce risk, increase resilience, and build stronger, verifiable trust with their customers and partners.
* **Elite Team & Mentorship:** 
  Direct collaboration with founders who prioritize technical excellence and high-performance culture.



  





 Please submit your CV along with a brief description of the most complex technical system you’ve built — how you approached it, how you executed, and what you learned.
 



  





 As part of our process, we conduct on-site work samples and practical technical tests.
 



 These are collaborative, realistic sessions designed to understand how you think, build, and solve problems in practice — not trick questions or whiteboard puzzles.
 



  





 If you’re a builder ready to define the intelligence layer for global business resilience, we’d love to hear from you.

title: SuperPOD Systems Engineer
description:
**About Sferical AI** 




 Sferical AI is a company co-founded by AstraZeneca, Ericsson, Saab, SEB and Wallenberg Investments. We provide a secure, sovereign AI infrastructure and high-performance compute to help leading Swedish companies develop and deploy advanced AI with real business impact.
 



  





 The infrastructure will be powered by NVIDIA DGX SuperPODs featuring the latest Grace Blackwell GB300 systems, delivering world-class performance for both production workloads and research. As part of the initiative, NVIDIA will establish an AI technology and development center in Sweden, supporting capability building across the partner companies.
 



  





 Sferical AI is now building the core DevOps team that will develop and operate this platform. The DevOps team will be based in central Stockholm, while the AI hardware infrastructure is hosted in Linköping. The role is on-site, with room for hybrid flexibility.
 



  





**About the role** 




 We are looking for a highly skilled SuperPOD Systems Engineer with deep expertise in HPC and GPU-based AI systems. In this role, you’ll be responsible for operating, optimizing and evolving Sferical’s NVIDIA SuperPOD environment. You’ll work at the intersection of supercomputing, orchestration and advanced scheduling to support AI workloads across several of Sferical’s partner companies.
 



  





 This is a hands-on role suited for someone who enjoys solving complex system challenges and working closely with AI teams to maximize performance and utilization.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Operate and optimize NVIDIA SuperPOD systems based on GB300, Mission Control/Base Command Manager, Kubernetes, Slurm and Run:AI
* Monitor system performance and manage the HPC network domain (Ethernet and InfiniBand)
* Collaborate closely with AI and engineering teams to maximize efficiency and resource utilization



  





**Who you are** 



* You excel in environments where HPC, containers and orchestration meet
* You have a strong systems mindset and enjoy working across hardware, software and performance layers
* You thrive in a growing team where processes are still being defined and improved
* Given the security clearance needed for this role, Swedish citizenship is required



  





**Qualifications** 



* Expertise in HPC operations, GPU clusters and Kubernetes-based AI platforms
* Experience with HPC storage solutions
* Strong knowledge of Kubernetes scheduling (Run:AI, KAI, Volcano), InfiniBand and NVIDIA GPU technologies
* Proficiency in Linux, container orchestration and CI/CD pipelines
* Preferred: Experience with NVIDIA Mission Control, Kubernetes, Run:AI, Slurm, NVIDIA Ethernet and InfiniBand, and automation frameworks (DevOps/GitOps, configuration management)
* Stand out: Experience in designing, building and operating HPC systems, with advanced understanding of MLOps and data science user needs



  





**What we offer** 



* The opportunity to help shape Sweden’s industrial AI capability from the ground up
* A strong professional network across some of Sweden’s leading companies and global tech leader NVIDIA
* A highly skilled and motivated team that values diversity and collaboration across disciplines and backgrounds
* Hands-on work with world-leading AI infrastructure and applications
* Competitive salary and benefits



  





 If this sounds like a role where you would thrive, we’d love to hear from you. Please apply directly through LinkedIn and include your CV and a short cover letter.
 



  





**How the process will work** 




 We want the recruitment process to feel clear and respectful of your time. All applicants will be invited to complete a short digital assessment as the first step, which helps us understand each candidate’s potential before we move to interviews. We review applications on a rolling basis, and selected candidates will then be invited to speak with the team. The aim is to keep the process structured, straightforward and focused on finding the right match for both you and Sferical. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
At Intric, we're on a mission to let everyone benefit from generative AI by making the creation and deployment of AI-based tools easy, open, and secure. Our collaborative web application is already a trusted resource within the Swedish public sector and we’ll now be entering a pivotal growth phase. Join us now and be a core part of our ambitious journey.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Frontend Engineer, you’ll lead the development of a fast, accessible and scalable web experience. Your work will range from building new features to refining our architecture, always with the end-user in focus. You'll collaborate closely with developers, product designers and business teams to continuously improve the platform across both desktop and mobile.
   

  

 Our tech stack consists of Node, TypeScript, HTML/CSS, Svelte/SvelteKit, Tailwind CSS. Infrastructure: Docker, Git, Jira
   

  

**The** 
**Team**
 You’ll be joining a cross-functional, fast-moving product team with a collaborative mindset. We keep processes lightweight and adapt as we go. You’ll have significant freedom to influence both technology and direction — and we value sharing, learning and pragmatic decisions above hierarchy or rigid frameworks.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 You have 3–5+ years of frontend engineering experience with a solid understanding of core web technologies (HTML/DOM, HTTP, JavaScript/TypeScript). Your experienced in building and scaling modern web applications and proficient in state management and caching (preferably in Svelte or similar frameworks).
   

  

 You can write efficient, maintainable, and accessible code with a collaborative mindset and strong communication skills.
   

  

 You might have a degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
   

  

 While not a must, experience with Svelte/SvelteKit and Tailwind CSS and familiarity with developer tooling and internal workflows is a plus.
   

  

**Perks**
* Flexible, trust-based work environment
* High degree of ownership and influence
* Work on meaningful technology with real societal impact
* A collaborative and curious team that values continuous learning

title: Python Code Reviewer for LLM Data Training
description:
**Weekly Hours:** 
 17-20 hours per week
 



**Assignment Duration:** 
 Approximately 2 to 3 weeks
 



**Timing:** 
 You have the flexibility to work at any time.
 



  





**Project Description** 




 This project involves reviewing AI-generated responses, evaluating technical accuracy and best practices, and providing expert feedback that trains AI systems to write better code. You'll work with various programming languages and coding challenges, ensuring AI outputs are functional, efficient, and follow industry standards.
 



  





**About Company** 




 We provide a platform that bridges subject-matter experts with AI projects, enabling them to contribute their knowledge to improve AI models. It offers flexible opportunities to work on tasks like data labeling, quality assurance, and domain-specific problem-solving while earning competitive pay.
 



  





**Hiring Profile** 



* BS, MS, or PhD with significant focus on Computer Science (Required).
* Expert in Python, with a strong grasp of algorithms, data structures, and debugging practices.
* Expert-level English proficiency with excellent writing skills.
* Expert at fact-checking information using public sources across multiple domains.
* Significant experience using large language models (LLMs).
* Strong analytical and structured thinking skills.
* Ability to explain complex programming concepts clearly and accurately.



  





**Preferred** 



* Prior experience with RLHF annotation.
* Prior Software Engineering work experience.
* Expertise in additional programming languages (nice to have): C#, Java, SQL, C++, TypeScript, PHP, C, Go, Bash, PowerShell, Rust, R.



  





**Application & Onboarding Process** 



* **Qualification exam (1–2 hours):** 
 evaluates your role-specific expertise. Compensation is provided upon passing.
* **Project exam (1–2 hours):** 
 evaluates your adherence to project guidelines and ability to produce
 **Python-specific** 
 deliverables. Compensation is provided upon passing.



  





**Commitment** 



* We expect a minimum of 17-20 hours per week; however, considering the project scope and timelines the preferred and recommended commitment would be 8 hours/day.

title: Backend Engineer
description:
**Backend Engineer** 




 Join us in building the backend that powers world-class creativity apps used by millions of people.
 



  





 Appostrophe is a Stockholm-based mobile app studio creating easy-to-use design tools that unlock people's creativity. Our flagship app SCRL is a top-ranked design tool for social media content creation, used and loved by millions worldwide. We're a small, ambitious team expanding our platform to the web, and we need a talented Backend Infrastructure Engineer to build the foundation that will power this growth.
 



  





 You'll be joining our data team to architect and build the backend systems that enable SCRL's expansion to the web, focusing on user accounts, subscription management, and cross-platform data synchronization, while at the same time strengthening our existing backend infrastructure which provides content to the millions of people using our iOS and Android app.
 



  





**What you will do** 




**Core Infrastructure & APIs** 




  




* Design and build robust account systems supporting, among others, email/password authentication and cross-platform user management.
* Develop and maintain RESTful APIs for user data, project storage, and subscription management.
* Implement secure authentication flows across web and mobile platforms.
* Build scalable storage solutions for user projects and account data.
* Strengthen our content delivery backend that returns templates, stickers and other content to all our platforms (iOS, Android, Web).
* Ensure scalability and stability of our backend across all platforms and platform versions.
* Support AI service delivery to the apps, such as our template recommendation system to suggest the right templates for our users.



  





**Subscription & Payment Systems** 



* Architect subscription management systems integrating with an external service for web payments.
* Implement subscription syncing across iOS, Android, and web platforms.
* Build subscription status validation and premium feature access controls.
* Develop subscription plan management (upgrades, downgrades, cancellations).



  





**Data Security & Compliance** 



* Implement GDPR-compliant data handling including consent management, data takeout, and deletion requests.
* Ensure secure backup systems and data integrity across platforms.
* Build audit trails for subscription and account changes.
* Maintain data structure consistency across web and mobile platforms.



  





**Platform Integration & Scaling** 



* Develop backend endpoints for mobile app account integration.
* Build systems for potential third-party integrations (Instagram connectivity, etc.).
* Optimize database performance and query efficiency for millions of users.
* Implement monitoring, logging, and error reporting systems.



  





**You should have** 




  





**Technical Expertise** 




**Backend Languages** 
 : Strong proficiency in Javascript, Typescript, React, or similar.
 



**Database Design** 
 : Experience with both SQL and NoSQL databases, understanding of data modeling for user accounts and subscriptions.
 



**API Development** 
 : Proven experience building RESTful APIs and understanding of API security best practices.
 



**Cloud Infrastructure** 
 : Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and infrastructure as code.
 



  





**System Design & Architecture** 




**Scalable Systems** 
 : Experience building systems that handle millions of users and high-throughput scenarios.
 



**Payment Integration** 
 : Knowledge of payment processing, subscription billing, and financial data handling.
 



**Security** 
 : Understanding of authentication, authorization, data encryption, and GDPR compliance requirements.
 



  





**Product & Business Understanding** 




**Subscription Apps** 
 : Experience with or strong interest in subscription-based app businesses and freemium models.
 



**Cross-Platform Thinking** 
 : Understanding of the complexities of syncing data and subscriptions across web, iOS, and Android.
 



**Data-Driven Approach** 
 : Comfortable working with analytics and ensuring proper event tracking for business insights.
 



  





**Collaboration & Communication** 




**Team Player** 
 : Ability to work closely with data engineers, frontend developers, and product teams.
 



**Clear Communication** 
 : Can explain complex technical concepts to non-technical team members.
 



**Problem Solving** 
 : Self-motivated with strong analytical and debugging skills.
 



  





**We offer** 




**High Impact Role** 
 : Your backend infrastructure will power millions of users' creative projects.
 



**Technical Growth** 
 : Opportunity to architect systems from scratch and work with modern technologies.
 



**Startup Environment** 
 : Fast-paced decision making with direct impact on product direction.
 



**Strong Team** 
 : Work alongside experienced data and engineering professionals in central Stockholm.
 



**Competitive Package** 
 : Market-rate salary with opportunities for professional development.
 



**Creative culture** 
 : be part of a profitable company that values creativity and user experience.

title: DevOps Engineer till Netler - Av utvecklare, för utvecklare
description:
*Netler söker en DevOps Engineer för spännande uppdrag hos några av Sveriges mest innovativa bolag. Bli en del av deras teknikdrivna team i Stockholm och skicka in din ansökan idag!* 




  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Vi söker en DevOps Engineer till Netler Consulting som kommer hjälpa till att effektivisera deras kunders release-flöden. Du kommer att arbeta med allt från Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines, samt hjälpa deras kunder med deras molninfrastruktur och möjliggöra flexibel infrastruktur, hostning, lagring och databehandling mer mera hos deras kunder. Du kommer arbeta med både on-prem lösningar, cloud och hybrid.
 



  





 Hos Netler får du chansen att påverka, utvecklas och samarbeta med seniora kollegor på ett ekonomiskt stabilt och långsiktigt växande konsultbolag som är grundat av erfarna utvecklare. De har sedan 2020 byggt en hållbar verksamhet och som idag består av ett team på över 20 seniora utvecklare som driver uppdrag för olika företag i Stockholm. Målet är att vara en partner för deras kunder, allt från etablerade bolag till innovativa startups, där de hjälper kunderna att utveckla sina system på ett hållbart och skalbart sätt.
 



  





**Du erbjuds** 



* **En arbetsplats som är byggt av utvecklare för utvecklare, vilket innebär en arbetsplats som värderar teknisk nyfikenhet, möjligheten att påverka vilka typer av projekt du arbetar med och ett stort nätverk av seniora kollegor att dela kunskap med och utvecklas med.**
* Tjänstepension hos Avanza med fri förfoganderätt och friskvård på 5000kr.
* Hos Netler får du chansen att fördjupa dig inom DevOps och närliggande tekniker som cloud och infrastruktur.
* En arbetsplats som värderar kulturen och sammanhållningen mellan medarbetarna och balans mellan arbetsliv och fritid.



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som DevOps Engineer kommer du att arbeta med infrastruktur på olika sätt, inklusive cloud engineering och sätta upp molninfrastruktur med nätverk, lastbalansering, landing zones och databaser i molnet. Du är en teknisk resurs hos kunden som stöttar dem med DevOps-lösningar, säkerställa driftsäkerhet och skapa och underhålla struktur och arbetsflöden. Du arbetar som konsult till Netlers kunder vilket innebär att du kommer få chansen att arbeta med olika teknologier, uppdrag och projekt.
 



  




* Designa, implementera och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines för att automatisera tester och distribution
* Hantera och optimera molninfrastrukturer (AWS, Azure, GCP), både on-prem, cloud och hybrid.
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam på uppdragen för smidiga deployment-processer
* Hantera och konfigurera Kubernetes-kluster för att säkerställa smidig distribution och drift av applikationer.
* Övervaka systemprestanda och säkerställa hög tillgänglighet



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* Har en kandidatexamen och/eller master inom relevant tekniskt område
* Har minst 2 års erfarenhet som DevOps Engineer eller liknande teknisk roll
* Arbetslivserfarenhet med containerteknologier som Kubernetes
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med CI/CD-verktyg, gärna med Jenkins eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnplattformar som AWS, Azure eller GCP
* Kännedom om eller erfarenhet med on-premise-lösningar.
* God kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska då arbetsspråket ute hos kund och internt är på båda språken



  





**Det är meriterande om du har** 



* Civilingenjörsexamen
* Förmåga att scripta i språk som Python, Bash eller Go.
* Kunskap i Prometheus, Grafana eller ELK-stack



  





**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:** 



* Förändringsbenägen
* Målmedveten
* Social
* Intellektuellt nyfiken



  





**Vår rekryteringsprocess** 




 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 



  





 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Vid ansökan efterfrågas ett CV. Personligt brev använder vi inte som urvalsmetod och behöver därför inte bifogas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
 



  





**Netler Consulting AB** 




 HÄR kan du läsa mer om Netler. Netler är ett ungt konsultbolag som är grundat av utvecklare med många år i branchen. De har vuxit stadigt sedan 2021 och har idag drygt 20 utvecklare som jobbar med olika kundprojekt runtom i Stockholm. De specialiserar sig på att hjälpa start-up och scale-up-bolag växla upp sin utveckling av antingen helt nya eller pågående projekt. De fokuserar på att skapa ett diversifierat team där alla är experter på sin egen teknikstack. Det innebär att utvecklarna samverkar och får tillgång till kunskap om diverse tekniker och ramverk direkt via deras interna kanaler. De tillhandahåller utvecklare för utveckling inom allt från backend- till frontendsystem, och även cloud och infrastruktur.

title: AWS Public Sector Cloud Architect
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirement**
* This role requires you to be a Swedish National and have business level proficiency in the Swedish language


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


 A day in the life
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 4+ years of experience in cloud architecture and implementation
* 4+ years of experience in consulting and working with customers
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* Experience with one of the following programming languages/technologies: Java, Python, Ruby, Node.js, C, or C++ and experience in DevOps, Cloud Infrastructure, AI, Security, Software Development or Databases is required


**Preferred Qualifications**
* AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) preferred and experience with automation and scripting (e.g., Terraform, Python, CDK, shell, Ruby, Powershell)
* Knowledge of security and compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR)
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Experience with AWS services (e.g. AWS Application Migration Service (MGN), Cloud Migration Factory, Portfolio analysis tooling) and managing large scale data center to data center and/or data center to cloud migrations; data center operations (e.g. data assurance, monitoring, alerting and notifications)
* Experience integrating AWS AI/ML services (SageMaker, Bedrock, Amazon Q); understanding of AI/ML governance and responsible AI practices


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us - and let the world feel your work.** 




  





 As a Fullstack Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the Growth / Monetization product team. Your role will be to experiment, design, and collaborate on building software systems and features that directly drive and optimize revenue strategies, having a direct and measurable impact on the company's financial success and user experience.
 



 The Growth / Monetization product team is focused on driving revenue growth by optimizing the company's pricing, packaging, product, and feature launches. Its core mission is to develop and implement user-centered approaches that maximize revenue potential while maintaining an excellent user experience.
 



  





**Your key responsibilities include:** 



* Influence how the team collaborates, ships code, and engages with stakeholders and dependencies, setting the foundation for our success.
* Be part of setting team-specific engineering standards, processes, and best practices from the start.
* Tackle fresh problems in a rapidly growing area, making a real impact on key business metrics like Conversion and MRR.
* Work closely with product managers, data analysts, designers, and marketing to ship high-impact changes.
* Your work will touch critical revenue-generating areas such as pricing, plans, international launches, upgrading and upselling paths.



  





**Requirements** 



* 4+ years of experience with React, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and IMS.
* 4+ years of experience with Python and/or GoLang.
* Proven experience with experimentation (A/B testing) and working with metrics to drive decisions.
* Adaptable: able to constantly learn from data, challenge the views we hold, and adjust to changing priorities and roadmaps.
* Collaborative: strong team member able to effectively work across functions, disciplines, teams, and product areas.
* Passionate about identifying challenges and building user-centric, revenue-generating solutions.



  





**Nice to have:** 



* Experience with Next.js.

**Equal opportunity employer** 




 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
