title: Cybersecurity Solution Engineer – Detect and Respond
description:
Are you ready to make a real difference in global cybersecurity? At Sandvik Group IT, we combine stability with innovation to deliver world-class solutions. We’re now looking for a Solution Engineer to strengthen our cybersecurity capabilities and help us stay ahead in an ever-evolving digital landscape.
   

  

**Your new team**
 You’ll join the Detect & Respond Platforms (DRP) product area – a key enabler for Sandvik’s Global Security Operations. Our mission is to provide expertise, support, and maintenance for critical security tools, with a strong focus on Microsoft E5 security solutions and Azure technologies. We’re a small, collaborative team that values transparency, knowledge sharing, and proactive problem-solving.
   

  

**About Your Job**
 In this position, you play a crucial role in enhancing productivity, profitability, and sustainability within the department. You work primarily with Microsoft E5 security stacks, including Microsoft XDR, Defender for Endpoint, and Sentinel, as well as Azure-based solutions. By providing your technical expertise, you support operations, drive deployment projects, and ensure our security posture aligns with best practices and industry standards. You’re involved throughout the lifecycle of services and solutions – from development to maintenance – and play a key role in knowledge sharing and capability building within the team.
   

  

 This role is flexible within Sweden and we offer a hybrid work solution. Your team is mainly located in Stockholm, while stakeholders are in Sandviken, so regular presence at these sites is expected.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We’re looking for an experienced engineer, preferably with a background in large global organizations. You have deep knowledge of Microsoft E5 licensing and security technologies (XDR, Defender for Endpoint, Sentinel) and Azure services. Experience with common policies, practices and procedures within Cybersecurity is a plus, along with knowledge in deployment projects and stakeholder management. You communicate fluently in English, and Swedish is an advantage.
   

  

 You have an analytical, problem-solving mindset and work independently with ease. Creative and adaptable, you thrive in a fast-changing environment and switch tasks effortlessly. As a true team player, you support and coach colleagues while challenging when needed. Your strong communication skills help you build trust and relationships across our global organization.
   

  

**Our culture**
 At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 For further information about this position, please contact Petra Englund, recruiting manager, petra.englund@sandvik.com.
   

  

 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts – Sweden
   

  

* Malena Rackner, Unionen, +46 (0)70 242 33 90
* Tord Engström, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)76 106 62 87
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55


 Recruitment Specialist: Therese Rutqvist
   

  

**How To Apply**
 This recruitment has an ongoing selection process, please send your application as soon as possible, and no later than December 7th, 2025. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0085602.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.
   

  

*Sandvik is a global, high-tech engineering group providing solutions that enhance productivity, profitability and sustainability for the manufacturing, mining and infrastructure industries. We are at the forefront of digitalization and focus on optimizing our customers’ processes. Our world-leading offering includes equipment, tools, services and digital solutions for machining, mining, rock excavation and rock processing. In 2024, the group had approximately 41,000 employees, sales in more than 150 countries and revenues of about SEK 123 billion.*

title: Sr Data Architect, Data Lake & Analytics
description:
**Description**
 Are you a Data Analytics specialist? Do you have Data Warehousing and/or Hadoop/Data Lake experience? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale (billions + records) data challenges in the world today? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners use cloud computing to do big new things faster and at lower cost? Do you want to be part of history and transform businesses through cloud computing adoption? Do you like to work on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high impact projects that use the newest data analytic technologies? Would you like a career path that enables you to progress with the rapid adoption of cloud computing?
   

  

 At AWS, we are hiring the best Data / Analytics cloud computing consultants, who can help our clients and partners derive business value from Data in the cloud. Our consultants will collaborate with partner and client teams to deliver proof-of-concept projects, conduct topical workshops, and lead implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as Machine Learning, IoT, batch/real-time data processing, Data and Business intelligence. This role will specifically focus on Data processing capabilities and helping our customers and partners to remove the constraints that prevent our customers from leveraging their data to develop business insights.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* As Senior Consultant you will lead complex projects with autonomy and discretion, often involving multiple Amazon and customer teams.
* You will work with customers and partners, leading them through planning, prioritization and delivery of complex transformation initiatives, while collaborating with relevant Sales and Service Teams.
* You will design and deliver solutions that solve for new levels of complexity, scale and performance, and in turn, enable breakthrough innovations.
* You will create and apply frameworks, methods, best practices and artifacts that deliver prescriptive guidance to customers, and publish and present them in large forums and across various media platforms.
* You will guide customers’ technical architecture and investments, maximizing alignment with the AWS platform, and ease of adoption as new services and products become available.
* You will help customers define target business outcomes and related work streams, and lead the subsequent projects and initiatives to consistently exceed these goals.
* As an Amazonian leader you will demonstrate the Amazon Leadership Principles, coaching and mentoring others on best practices, performance and career development.
* This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.


 A day in the life
   

  

 AWS Global Services includes experts from across AWS who help our customers design, build, operate, and secure their cloud environments. Customers innovate with AWS Professional Services, upskill with AWS Training and Certification, optimize with AWS Support and Managed Services, and meet objectives with AWS Security Assurance Services. Our expertise and emerging technologies include AWS Partners, AWS Sovereign Cloud, AWS International Product, and the Generative AI Innovation Center. You’ll join a diverse team of technical experts in dozens of countries who help customers achieve more with the AWS cloud.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience, in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field
* 8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a highly technical and analytical role.
* 5+ years’ experience of Data Lake/Hadoop platform implementation, including 3+ years of hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning Hadoop/Spark implementations
* Ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment.
* Experience with analytic solutions applied to the Marketing or Risk needs of enterprises


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in a Chief Data Architect role or similar
* Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math.
* Hands on experience leading large-scale global data warehousing and analytics projects.
* Ability to lead effectively across organizations.
* Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP and NoSQL databases, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting and Dashboard development.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch) - G54
   

  

 Job ID: A3130453

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
Senior Engineering Manager - StrongPoint
 



  





*StrongPoint is a leading retail technology company helping grocery and convenience retailers run smarter, more efficient and more customer-centric operations. Our solutions include click & collect, self-checkout, cash management and advanced order picking, all powered by data, automation and cloud technology.* 




*We are now scaling our Order Picking SaaS platform globally, enabling retailers across Europe to transform how they fulfill online orders in-store and across their networks. As part of this journey, we’re looking for a Senior Engineering Manager who wants to lead cross-functional engineering teams and influence the technical direction of one of our most strategic product areas.* 




  





***How You Will Make an Impact***




 As a Senior Engineering Manager for StrongPoint’s Order Picking SaaS platform, you will lead multiple cross-functional engineering teams responsible for building and scaling our cloud-native, mobile-first solution. You’ll guide technical direction, drive delivery and build strong engineering capabilities across a distributed organisation.
 



  





***You will:***




 • Lead and develop 2–3 high-performing, cross-functional agile teams across several geographies
 



 • Coach and grow engineering talent, including senior engineers and technical leads
 



 • Build an inclusive and feedback-driven culture focused on learning and empowerment
 



 • Provide clarity and direction during periods of change and continued product scaling
 



 • Define and monitor engineering KPIs and delivery metrics
 



 • Collaborate closely with Commercial, Product and UX to translate business goals into engineering plans and platform roadmaps
 



 • Guide the platform’s architectural evolution with a focus on scalability and resilience
 



 • Promote engineering best practices across automation, CI/CD, observability, quality and DevOps
 



 • Offer hands-on leadership in critical technical decisions and escalation scenarios
 



 • Support strategic initiatives such as platform unification, cloud modernisation and AI-driven capabilities
 



 • Contribute to shaping StrongPoint’s broader technical vision and operating model
 



  





***To be successful in this role, we believe that you…***




 • Have 6+ years of experience in software engineering with a solid technical foundation and modern cloud-based architectures
 



 • Bring 3+ years of experience leading multiple agile engineering teams in a product- and customer-centric environment
 



 • Have proven experience in SaaS or enterprise-grade system design, ideally with multi-tenant, distributed or event-driven architectures
 



 • Understand DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure-as-code and cloud deployment automation
 



 • Have led teams through technical and organisational change
 



 • Are strong in people leadership: coaching, feedback and career development
 



 • Make collaborative and data-driven decisions with a long-term mindset
 



 • Communicate clearly across both technical and business audiences
 



 • Bonus: experience with .NET, Azure, mobile-first product environments or data/AI-enabled platforms
 



  





***Why Join StrongPoint***




 At StrongPoint you will play a key role in scaling a flagship SaaS product used by leading European retailers. You will work with modern technology such as .NET, Azure, React/Angular and MAUI, and contribute to how AI and automation are used in the future of retail fulfillment. This role gives you the opportunity to influence both the platform strategy and the way our engineering organisation works as we grow. You will collaborate with international colleagues and customers and see the impact of your work directly in grocery stores and everyday retail operations. You will join a collaborative and empowering environment with strong executive support and a clear transformation agenda, where your ideas and leadership can truly make a difference.
 



  





***About StrongPoint***




 StrongPoint is a retail technology company that provides solutions and services designed to make stores smarter, shopping experiences better and online grocery fulfillment more efficient. With more than 500 employees across Norway, Sweden, the Baltics and Spain, and supported by a broad partner network, the company delivers its technology to retailers in over 25 countries across four continents.
 



 For more than 35 years, StrongPoint has worked closely with grocery retailers to understand their challenges and develop innovative technology that increases productivity, reduces costs and drives operational efficiency both in-store and online. StrongPoint is headquartered in Norway and listed on the Oslo Stock Exchange under the ticker STRONG.
 



  





**Application** 




 If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, and if you believe you are the right person for us, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible. Selection is ongoing.
 



 In this recruitment, StrongPoint is collaborating with HCM Partner AB.
 



 If you have any questions about the role, please contact Carl Kleine, 073 3204324.

title: Tech Lead / Data Architect
description:
Om rollen och teamet
   

  

 BI-teamet på Implema är en växande och ambitiös enhet som befinner sig i en spännande fas där innovation, tillväxt och värdeskapande står i centrum. Våra kunder står inför stora möjligheter att effektivisera och utveckla sina verksamheter - och vi hjälper dem att göra det möjligt genom datadrivna lösningar.
   

  

 Med hjälp av avancerade
 **Data Analytics-plattformar** 
 stöttar vi dem i att fatta smartare beslut, upptäcka nya affärsmöjligheter och skapa dynamiska, automatiserade lösningar som förenklar deras vardag. Hos oss får du möjlighet att påverka riktningen framåt och spela en nyckelroll i hur vi bygger nästa generations dataplattformar.
   

  

 Är du vår nya kollega?
   

  

 Vi söker nu en
 **senior Data Architect eller Tech Lead** 
 med en stark bakgrund inom
 **data engineering och analytics** 
 och som vill ta nästa steg till att bidra med både tekniskt ledarskap och strategiskt tänkande.
   

  

 Rollen riktar sig till dig som är van att ta ansvar för hela lösningskedjan, från arkitektur och design till implementation och leverans. Du är affärsmässig, lösningsorienterad och trivs i en miljö där initiativ, samarbete och nytänkande värderas högt – och du brinner för att skapa datalösningar som gör verklig skillnad för verksamheten.
   

  

**Vi tror att du har:**
* Minst 8 års erfarenhet inom data engineering eller data analytics,
* Varav minst 4 år som Data Architect eller Tech Lead med ansvar för design och implementation av dataplattformar
* Djup teknisk och hands-on erfarenhet av moderna verktyg och plattformar såsom: databricks, snowflake, azure samt .dbt eller andra data pipeline-verktyg
* God förståelse för datamodellering, data governance och lösningsarkitektur
* Gedigen erfarenhet av SQL och Python


**Vad vi erbjuder?**
 Vi tror på ett arbetsklimat där kunskap delas, initiativ uppmuntras och varje medarbetare får utvecklas – både professionellt och personligt. Med höga ambitioner och högt i tak skapar vi en miljö där det är lätt att trivas. För oss är det viktigt med work-life-balance, och vi värnar om en trygg arbetsmiljö där du mår bra och känner dig sedd.
   

  

**Marknadsmässiga villkor och förmåner som stödjer dig**
 Utöver konkurrenskraftig lön erbjuder vi en flexibel hybridarbetsmodell, trygga pensions- och försäkringslösningar samt friskvårdsbidrag. Dessutom bjuder vi in på sociala aktiviteter som after work, kickoff och konferensresor
   

  

 Implema är en av Sveriges ledande specialister på att snabbt implementera affärssystem baserat på marknadens ledande affärssystem SAP och Microsoft Dynamics. Med mer än 20 års erfarenhet av affärskritiska projekt guidar Implema svenska och internationella företag till effektiva och hållbara affärsprocesser och den snabbaste vägen till framtidens affärssystem. Vi vill finnas nära våra kunder och har kontor på 10 orter runt om i Sverige och omsätter 500 MSEK. Vi växer och vill bli fler!

title: Compute Sales Specialist
description:
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2 days per week from an HPE office.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
   

  

**Job Description**
**HPE Compute is looking for a Compute Sales Specialist**
 HPE (Hewlett Packard Enterprise) is offering an exciting opportunity in a market that is moving faster than ever before. With HPE strong innovation culture, we develop our products and services to meet the demands of our customers in a world of digital transformation and AI
 *.*
 HPE is a proud leader in the server market and known as the most innovative vendor in the marketplace. Our culture is characterized by a no-nonsense culture with high drive and optimistic people; entrepreneurs who embrace the constant transformation that our industry is facing and looking for new market opportunities to keep and expand our leading market position.
   

  

 We are now looking for our next colleague. In the role as
 **Compute Sales Specialist,** 
 you are responsible for leading the pursuit for Compute business. You are specialized on the compute products, solutions, services and software portfolio.
   

  

 You will collaborate with and support Account Managers, provide compute expertise within the sales team and to assigned customers. Drive proactive sales, use your specialized knowledge and skills to prospect, qualify, negotiate, and close opportunities.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Responsible for sales of Compute products and solutions in assigned accounts.
* Seeks out new opportunities through prospecting, industry networking and events.
* Create and drive Compute business pipeline and opportunities.
* Drives the Compute sales process, contributes to proposal development in collaboration with Presales, lead negotiations and deal closings.
* Negotiates and drives profitable deals to ensure successful closure and a high win rate.
* Works closely with the Account Manager, providing technical expertise and support.
* Effectively uses internal sales tools to maintain a healthy pipeline and the account plan in a timely fashion.
* Collaborates across the HPE teams to deliver a consistent approach to developing business, including account planning for end-to-end solutions.
* Directs and coordinates supporting sales activities related to pipeline hygiene through account managers, Presales, channel partners and other relevant stakeholders
* Focuses on and works with the channel to forge relationships, provide enablement of key technologies, and co-sell to end-users.
* Reinforces and articulates HPE's strategy and portfolio to partners and champions to uncover new business opportunities and contacts, including new logos.
* Effectively uses references to craft a story that makes complex technologies seem simple and understandable for the customers.
* Actively generates customer interest and understands the customer's buying trends. Links business and financial benefits with technology offerings. Illustrates the ROI & TCO advantages of HPE offerings for the customer's business.
* Contributes to development of quota objectives and future direction for Compute portfolio.


**Skills Requirements**
* Understanding Compute / Servers products, services and software offerings.
* Understand the competition and differentiate presenting HPE’s unique values.
* Understands the industry and market segment in which key accounts are situated and integrates this knowledge into consultative selling.
* Business planning skills, multi-dimensional.
* Experienced with working with channel partners and/or end-users


**About You**
* University or bachelor’s degree preferred.
* Typically, 5-10+ years of Sales experience.
* Compute/server related sales experience strongly desired.
* Ability to interface with diverse business customers.
* Enjoy meeting and connecting with new people.
* Demonstrated achievement of progressively higher quota.
* Proactively striving for improvements and willingness to continues learning.
* Strong communication skills.
* Agile and adaptive to changes.
* Team player with ability to work independently
* Fluency in Swedish and English is required.


**Additional Skills**
 Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Assertiveness, Bias, Building Rapport, Buyer Personas, Coaching, Complex Sales, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Customer Experience Strategy, Customer Interactions, Design Thinking, Empathy, Financial Acumen, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Identifying Sales Opportunities, Industry Knowledge, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity {+ 6 more}
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
**Health & Wellbeing**
 We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.
   

  

**Personal & Professional Development**
 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.
   

  

**Unconditional Inclusion**
 We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.
   

  

**Let's Stay Connected**
 Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.
   

  

 #sweden
   

  

 #compute, #sales
   

  

**Job**
 Sales
   

  

**Job Level**
 Expert
   

  

 HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, or any other protected category, and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. Please click here: Equal Employment Opportunity.
   

  

**Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.**
 HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to employer use of arrest and conviction records, including laws requiring employers to consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.
   

  

**No Fees Notice & Recruitment Fraud Disclaimer**
*It has come to HPE’s attention that there has been an increase in recruitment fraud whereby scammer impersonate HPE or HPE-authorized recruiting agencies and offer fake employment opportunities to candidates. These scammers often seek to obtain personal information or money from candidates.*
*Please note that Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), its direct and indirect subsidiaries and affiliated companies, and its authorized recruitment agencies/vendors
 **will never charge any candidate a registration fee, hiring fee, or any other fee in connection with its recruitment and hiring process.** 
 The credentials of any hiring agency that claims to be working with HPE for recruitment of talent should be verified by candidates and candidates shall be solely responsible to conduct such verification. Any candidate/individual who relies on the erroneous representations made by fraudulent employment agencies does so at their own risk, and HPE disclaims liability for any damages or claims that may result from any such communication.*

title: SAP Analytics-konsult!
description:
**Vi växer inom SAP och söker dig med erfarenhet inom SAP Analytics Cloud, S/4HANA Embedded Analytics, SAP Datasphere och SAP BW/4HANA som vill vara med och göra skillnad och skapa värde tillsammans med oss och våra kunder. Ansök idag!** 




  





 Gillar du att utvecklas tillsammans med andra erfarna specialister i en kreativ och dynamisk miljö med spännande kunduppdrag? Ser du fram emot att få vara med i utvecklande, krävande och ledande roller i våra kunders viktigaste projekt, ofta i de tidiga faserna kopplat till taktiska och strategiska dimensioner? Då kommer du att trivas i vår miljö och kan se fram emot en stimulerande och utvecklande resa tillsammans med oss.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet som konsult inom SAP Analytics Cloud, S/4HANA Emb.edded Analytics och SAP Datasphere (SAP Data Warehouse Cloud) och som brinner för att fortsätta utvecklas och leverera innovativa och kvalitativa lösningar till våra kunder. Vi arbetar i effektiva team med våra kunder och tillsammans skapar vi flexibla och förvaltningsbara lösningar baserade på både kundernas egna infrastruktur och molnlösningar.
 



 Vi gillar att vara med i de tidiga faserna för att stödja våra kunder i de taktiska och strategiska dimensionerna med rådgivning, förstudier/översyn, kravhantering, arkitektur, upphandling/utvärderingar, Proof-of-Concepts m.m.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder dig** 



* Möjligheten att jobba med många av Sveriges mest framstående företag och organisationer
* Intressanta och utmanande uppdrag
* Kompetenta kollegor med några av de bästa experterna inom SAP
* En möjlighet till att jobba på ett företag där kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och möjlighet att ständigt utveckla dina kunskaper alltid är i fokus



  





 Hos oss kommer du att arbeta i ett värderingsstyrt förtag där tre värdeord ligger nära våra hjärtan och tillsammans bygger den kultur som vi vill ha.
 



**Kraft:** 
 Våra medarbetare har viljan och drivkraften att utveckla sig själva och sin omgivning.
 



**Medmänsklighet:** 
 Vår företagskultur präglas av ärlighet, öppenhet, gemenskap och omtanke.
 



**Professionalism:** 
 Vi tar ansvar, håller vad vi lovar, ser helheter och bidrar alltid till lösningar.
 



  





 Avegas matchningsprincip 1:1 är ett löfte som strävar efter en 100% matchning mellan våra konsulters kompetenser och våra kunders behov. Det innebär att våra konsulter alltid är med och väljer sina uppdrag, och kunden är försäkrad om en engagerad konsult som brinner för sin uppgift. Vi vill att du ska vara med och påverka din vardag och på så sätt hålla dig motiverad under hela resan.
 



 Avega lägger stort fokus på din kontinuerliga utveckling där ditt uppdrag tillsammans med Avegas kompetensforum Elevate är viktiga komponenter för att du ska lyckas.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 



* Vi söker dig som är erfaren konsult inom SAP S/4HANA Analytics Cloud, SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics, SAP BW/4HANA och SAP Datasphere (SAP Data Warehouse Cloud) och vill göra skillnad hos våra kunder, ofta inom ledande roller.
* Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet och kunskap inom SAP Activate.
* Du har erfarenhet från att arbeta i konsultrollen samt är kommunikativ och trygg i ledande roller.
* Vi ser gärna att du har kunskap och förståelse kring SAP:s erbjudande RISE with SAP.



  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Chromatography Solutions Specialist
description:
**Job Description**
**Bring More to Life – Join Us in Shaping the Future of Science**
 Are you ready to accelerate your potential and make a real difference within life sciences, diagnostics and biotechnology?
   

  

 At
 **Phenomenex** 
 , one of
 **Danaher’s** 
**15+ operating companies** 
 , our work saves lives. We’re united by a shared commitment to innovation with tangible impact. Here, you’ll thrive in a culture of belonging—where your unique perspective matters. By harnessing Danaher’s system of continuous improvement, you’ll help turn ideas into action, innovating at the speed of life.
   

  

 Phenomenex isn’t your typical scientific company. Phenomenex is a global technology leader developing cutting-edge analytical chemistry solutions that solve complex separation and purification challenges. Our work enhances and saves lives, ensuring the quality of essentials like food, water, shampoo, and even cold medication.
   

  

 Join our global success story and help accelerate the discovery, development, and delivery of solutions that safeguard and improve human health.
   

  

 Learn about the Danaher Business System – the engine behind our innovation.
   

  

 Do you want to work in Sales, using your scientific background to help our customers in solving their analytical challenges?
   

  

 We are currently seeking an
 **Chromatography Solutions Specialist** 
 within our Inbound Sales Team who will be responsible for supporting our customers with their technical, product and order related inquiries whilst meeting and exceeding sales and unit goals. This position will include occasional travel in the south of Sweden.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
* Respond to customer enquiries via chat, phone, web, and email with product support, quotes, and order assistance.
* Support sales efforts by providing technical expertise on chromatography solutions.
* Deliver product info, recommendations, and basic application guidance.
* Use CRM, ERP, and support tools to document and manage interactions.
* Help achieve sales targets while ensuring excellent customer service.


**The Essential Requirements Of The Role Include**
* Bachelor’s degree or higher in a Life Science (e.g. Chemistry, Biology).
* Experience in Technical Sales or Customer Service.
* Strong teamwork mindset, organizational skills, and multitasking ability.
* Valid drivers license
* Fluency in Danish, Swedish and English


 Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.
   

  

 For more information, visit www.danaher.com.

title: Senior CRO Specialist
description:
På TRKKN drivs vi av att lyfta våra kunders data-drivna resa till nya höjder. Som Europas ledande Google-partner och återförsäljare av Google Cloud och Google Marketing Platform fungerar vi som en katalysator för banbrytande digitala marknadsföringslösningar.
 



  





 Vårt team är mångfaldigt, internationellt och inspirerande, och vi verkar i en snabbt växande digital och teknologisk miljö. Detta ger en dynamisk arbetsplats för individer som drivs av en hunger efter tillväxt, ansvar, och en önskan att forma sin egen framtid. Med en nära relation till Google är möjligheterna för lärande och utveckling på TRKKN stora.
 



  





 På TRKKN Sverige är vi ett nystartat lokalt team av 4 personer och befinner oss i en expansiv tillväxtfas där du får vara med och bygga TRKKN Sverige. Vi har ett nära samarbete med våra systerbyråer OMD, PHD, Hearts & Science, TransAct, Annalect, Fuse och Drum som tillsammans består av 270+ fantastiska medarbete på den svenska marknaden.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som senior CRO-specialist kommer du att vara en viktig del i att driva konverteringsoptimering och webbanalys för TRKKNs kunder genom operativt arbete likaväl som införsäljning och produktutveckling. Detta inkluderar bland annat:
 



  




* Arbeta operativt och strategiskt med optimeringen av våra kunders webbplatser och plattformar
* Vara en specialist inom CRO och webbanalys och stödja kunderna i hela CRO-processen från datainsamling till uppsättning av tester och analyser med ett proaktivt förhållningssätt
* Bygga interna relationer likaväl som kundrelationer för att möjliggöra införsäljning av nya kunduppdrag
* Utveckla TRKKNs produktportfölj inom CRO och webbanalys



  





**Vem är du?** 




  




* Utbildning inom digital marknadsföring med fokus på analys och optimering
* Du har en mycket god förståelse för och erfarenhet inom webbanalys, CRO och UX
* Du har mycket goda kunskaper inom Google Analytics 4 och Tag Manager
* Du har goda kunskaper i kodning och känner sig bekväm med HTML, CSS och Javascript för att koda de A/B tester som du genomför tillsammans med kunderna
* Du har erfarenhet av experimenteringsverktyg som exempelvis VWO eller Optimizely
* Stark analytisk förmåga och eget driv



  





**Meriterande:** 




  




* Erfarenhet av verktyg inom Google Marketing Platform
* Erfarenhet av Cloud lösningar



  





**Vi erbjuder dig** 




  




* En uppsjö av afterworks, konferensresor, event och roliga aktiviteter som gör att vi lär känna varandra både som kollegor och vänner
* Förmåner som tjänstepension och försäkringar, friskvårdsbidrag med tillgång till förmånsportalen Benify
* 37,5 timmars arbetsvecka med flexibelt kontorsarbete
* Nyrenoverande lokaler på Södermalm med Stockholms bästa utsikt över Gamla stan och Djurgården



  





**Intresserad?** 




 Vi hoppas att du vill bli en del av vår fortsatta resa och ser fram emot att lära känna dig bättre. Vi intervjuar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista svarsdatum. För frågor om tjänsten, varmt välkommen att kontakta Evelina Jörhov, Head of TRKKN Sverige, evelina.jorhov@omc.com.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: SAP Senior Consultant (Order to cash)
description:
At PBS Nordics, a Capgemini business unit, we empower individuals to shape their careers within a collaborative global community.
   

  

 Specializing in ERP transformation services for both public and private sectors, PBS Nordics delivers tailored solutions using top ERP systems like SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, and IFS. With a strong Nordic presence and a diverse global client portfolio, we guide organizations through seamless ERP transformations, driving operational excellence and strategic growth.
   

  

**Your role**
 We are seeking skilled Senior SAP Consultants with experience in RICEFW (Reports, Interfaces, Conversions, Enhancements, Forms, and Workflows) to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in SAP project management and development, with a proven track record of delivering high-quality solutions.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Configure and maintain the SAP O2C (SD) module, and support users and address O2C-related issues.
* Collaborate with Sales, Finance, and Logistics for seamless workflows.
* Implement improvements and optimizations in the O2C process.
* Lead SAP O2C implementation and upgrade projects.
* Lead consulting projects from start to finish, ensuring client satisfaction and timely delivery.
* Build strong client relationships, providing tailored SAP solutions.
* Facilitate and lead workshops with stakeholders to gather requirements, align expectations, and drive solution design.
* Mentor junior consultants and foster a collaborative team environment.
* Develop and implement strategic plans to meet project goals and drive business growth.
* Prepare and present detailed reports to clients and stakeholders.


**Your Profile:**
* 7+ years of hands-on experience in SAP SD (Sales & Distribution) with a focus on O2C processes.
* Strong experience in configuring and maintaining the SAP O2C module.
* Expertise in RICEFW (Reports, Interfaces, Conversions, Enhancements, Forms, Workflows).
* Proven ability to manage SAP projects and deliver high-quality solutions.
* Strong analytical skills and problem-solving abilities.
* Experience in at least one S/4 transformation.


*Note: Nordic-based and fluency in English; proficiency in Swedish is preferred. Open to travel.*
**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training, a global network of experts and an innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success.
* Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations.
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness.
* A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person


**Application**
*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required* 
 .
   

  

**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: SAP EWM Solution Architect
description:
If you enjoy working with high-calibre people on interesting projects in a thriving partnership organization, Westernacher is the place to be!
   

  

 To complement our team in
 **Sweden** 
 , we are looking for an
 **SAP EWM Solution Architect** 
**.**
**Your Responsibilities**
* Successfully implement business processes and develop solutions in the area of Supply Chain Execution based on SAP EWM
* Take responsibility for the planning and implementation of EWM projects
* Configure SAP EWM incl. doing tests, writing documentation and performing validation
* Support the development team by creating specifications and test scripts
* Take responsibility for the planning and implementation of EWM projects
* Participate in pre-sales activities and customer workshops


**Your Skills And Experience**
* 7+ years of implementing SAP WM / EWM
* Functional / technical proficiency with at least 4 full cycle SAP WM / EWM implementations, design, configuration, testing and experience in different industries
* Good cross-module knowledge to design end-to-end logistics processes (SD, MM, LE-Shipping, Yard and Transportation)
* Experience in creating and delivering customer proposals and presales workshops
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in Swedish and English (other languages are an advantage)
* Good team player with very good logical and reasoning skills, who enjoys working in a global environment and is committed to high-quality project delivery
* Willingness and availability to travel if the project requires it


**Our Promise**
* A diverse and versatile role with ample opportunities to shape your work in a 100% employee-owned company
* Competitive remuneration package
* Inspiring and exciting, innovative working environment
* Partnership culture with a strong entrepreneurial spirit and opportunity for partnership/co-ownership
* Environment of open communication, trust and regular feedback
* International company culture and minimal hierarchical structure
* Chance to work on complex projects from different industries and add to your business process knowhow
* Flexible working hours and hybrid working model


**Interested? Then, don't hesitate to apply!**
**This Is WE**
 Committed to innovation, since 1969 Westernacher Consulting operates worldwide, with more than 1000 consultants in Europe, Asia and the Americas. We provide global business and SAP consulting, serving medium to large sized enterprises striving for innovation, operational excellence and profitable, sustainable growth. Headquartered in Heidelberg, Germany, Westernacher Consulting is the global leader in business process and technology innovation.
   

  

 Living, working, and operating in partnership. We are inquisitive, creative thinkers with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. We question new ways of working, think differently and are willing to try out new approaches to create value and innovation for our customers. All of this makes us pioneers in our field and keeps us responsive, quality-focused and results-oriented.
   

  

 Westernacher is a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Westernacher is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
   

  

 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

title: Dell Technologies Presales Academy - Technical Inside Sales
description:
Our sales professionals rely on proactive technical consultants during the sales process – and our expert Presales team always steps up to the mark. We lead the development and implementation of complex and specialized products, applications, services, and solutions. From delivering sales presentations and product demonstrations, to developing detailed installations or system integration plans, we ensure customers get the innovative, relevant, interoperable solutions they need.
   

  

 Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Dell Technologies
 **Technical Inside Sales** 
 on our
 **Dell Technologies Presales Academy** 
 Team in the Solna Sweden office.
   

  

**What you’ll achieve:**
 The
 **Dell Technologies** 
**Presales Academy** 
 is a 12 – 24-month training program designed to develop recent college and university graduates into skilled
 **Inside Presales Solution Specialists** 
 . The role of a
 **Technical Inside Sales** 
 blends the art of sales with the science of technology. We strive to act as trusted advisors to our customers to help recommend and design technology-based products and solutions. Following the training program, participants will be part of our Inside Presales organization where they will work with sales teams and customers to accomplish their IT initiatives and solve business challenges.
   

  

**You will:**
* Undergo Intensive Academy Training: Participate in a structured training program that covers Dell Technologies’ advanced data center infrastructure, networking, and AI solutions
* Learn the Ropes and Stay Ahead: Gain hands-on experience with our cutting-edge data center solutions and explore the latest trends in cloud computing and AI, while discovering how modern IT infrastructure is evolving and helping customers adapt to exciting new technologies
* Customer Connection: Develop your skills in understanding customer needs and crafting tailored tech solutions that set us above the rest
* Team Collaboration: Work alongside diverse teams to create innovative solutions that tackle real-world challenges
* Present with Confidence: Share your knowledge through engaging product demos and presentations that showcase our portfolio’s breadth of comprehensive solutions


**Take the first step towards your dream career**
 Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:
   

  

**Essential Requirements**
* Undergraduate or Master's Degree earned in a technical field no more than 36 months before start date.
* Excellent technology skills, outstanding interpersonal abilities, strong written and verbal communication skills; fluent in English and Swedish – strong communication skills are key.
* Attention to detail, problem-solving capabilities, and being an innovative thinker with a self-starter, desire-to-win type mindset.
* Consultative technical design and selling skills combined with a strong aptitude for technical curiosity.
* Interested in continuous learning and committed to developing technical and consultative capabilities.


**Desirable Requirements**
* Internship experience in technology-related field or a technology company.
* Participation in roles outside of class (clubs, sports, etc.)


**Who We Are**
 We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That’s why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. If you’re looking for an opportunity to grow your career with some of the best minds and most advanced tech in the industry, we’re looking for you.
   

  

 Dell Technologies is a unique family of businesses that helps individuals and organizations transform how they work, live and play. Join us to build a future that works for everyone because Progress Takes All of Us.
   

  

 Dell Technologies is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.

title: R&D Project Manager
emails: Paul.Jedenfalk@siemens-energy.com, Johanna.sangrud@siemens-energy.com, unionen.finspang.se@siemens-energy.com, asi.se@siemens-energy.com, anders.fors@siemens-energy.com, mikael.malmgren@siemens-energy.com
description:
**A Snapshot of Your Day**



Join us as an R&D Project Manager, where you will lead medium to large R&D projects that are pivotal in shaping the future of Siemens Energy’s products. Imagine guiding your multicultural, agile team from the initial concept all the way to sales release and validation. You will create clear plans, break them into actionable deliverables, and inspire your team to tackle technical challenges with innovative solutions.



In addition to managing individual projects, you will have the chance to engage in strategic portfolio management. This involves overseeing a group of initiatives, ensuring they align with our technology roadmap, prioritizing based on business value and feasibility, and identifying synergies to optimize resources. You’ll track portfolio performance against KPIs, transparently report progress and risks, and help shape the future project pipeline by evaluating emerging technologies and market needs.



Your day will be dynamic, involving alignment with multiple stakeholders across cultures and time zones, facilitating energizing workshops, and steering sub-project leads toward shared milestones. By applying a blend of agile and traditional project management methods, you will maintain strong momentum and deliver impactful results. Every day, you’ll thrive in a diverse, innovative, and supportive team environment where collaboration drives breakthroughs. Your leadership will directly influence technical progress, enhance team performance, and ensure Siemens Energy delivers cleaner, more reliable, and sustainable energy solutions to customers worldwide.

  

**How You’ll Make an Impact**


* Execute medium and major R&D projects within the Product Development Process (PDP).
* Balance project constraints including scope, time, cost, and quality.
* Plan project timelines, deliverables, and team responsibilities.
* Manage risks effectively to ensure project success.
* Foster resource management and team spirit to enhance collaboration.
* Report on progress and proactively address challenges.

  

**What You Bring**


* You possess knowledge and experience in Siemens Energy R&D Project Management (or are eager to learn).
* You hold an MSc or BSc in Engineering.
* You demonstrate strong leadership and interpersonal skills.
* You are solution-oriented and flexible, with a strong drive to achieve defined project targets.
* You have good English language skills; Swedish language skills are a plus.
* A project management certification (e.g., PMP, IPMA, PM@Siemens) is advantageous.
* Proficiency in Office 365 and project management software such as MSP, Planview, or Primavera.

  

**About the Team**

Join a dynamic and diverse team of passionate professionals dedicated to driving innovation in energy technology. Our R&D team is at the forefront of developing cutting-edge solutions that address the challenges of tomorrow’s energy landscape. We thrive on collaboration, leveraging each team member’s unique strengths to foster creativity and achieve ambitious goals.



In this supportive environment, you will work alongside experts from various disciplines, sharing knowledge and insights to push the boundaries of what is possible. Together, we are committed to not only meeting the needs of our customers but also contributing to a sustainable future. With a focus on continuous improvement and learning, our team embraces new ideas and technologies, ensuring that we remain leaders in the energy sector. Join us, and be part of a mission that makes a real difference in the world!



Our **Gas Services division** offers Low-emission power generation through service and decarbonization. Zero or low emission power generation and all gas turbines under one roof, steam turbines and generators. Decarbonization opportunities through service offerings, modernization, and digitalization of the fleet.

  


We can offer you employment benefits such as: reduction of working hours, advance vacation, health care allowance and an eventual possibility to a flexible working place.

  

**Who is Siemens Energy?**



At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. With ~100,000 dedicated employees in more than 90 countries, we develop the energy systems of the future, ensuring that the growing energy demand of the global community is met reliably and sustainably. The technologies created in our research departments and factories drive the energy transition and provide the base for one sixth of the world's electricity generation.

  


Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

  


Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity**



Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

  

**Application**



Don’t hesitate – apply via https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/en\_US/jobs or https://siemensenergy.avature.net/internalcareers , id nr 283542 not later than 2025-12-07.

  


Ongoing selection is applied, the role might be filled before last application date.



For questions about the role, please contact the recruiting manager Paul Jedenfalk on Paul.Jedenfalk@siemens-energy.com or tel. 070-3759658



For questions about the recruitment process please contact the responsible recruiter Johanna Sangrud on Johanna.sangrud@siemens-energy.com



We refrain from all contact with staffing and recruitment companies, or advertising brokers.

  


Location: Finspång

  

**Trade Union Representatives:**  

Unionen, unionen.finspang.se@siemens-energy.com  

Sveriges Ingenjörer & SACO, asi.se@siemens-energy.com
  

Ledarna, Anders Fors, anders.fors@siemens-energy.com
  

IF Metall, Mikael Malmgren, mikael.malmgren@siemens-energy.com

  

  

**#LI-JS6**

title: Technical Leader with focus on pre-studies
description:
Join a company where innovation meets purpose. At Toyota Material Handling's R&D department, Auto Solutions, we're not just developing autonomous warehouse vehicles - we're shaping the future of logistics. Here you'll have the opportunity to work close to the products in an environment that values collaboration, continuous learning, and real impact. Your ideas matter, your growth is supported, and your contribution helps us move the world smarter, safer, and more sustainably. Become part of something bigger-where technology drives progress and people drive innovation.
  
  

Your team and task to look forward to
  
At Auto Solutions we invest and have an exciting journey ahead of us. Currently, we are approx. 70 team members within Auto Solutions. The Complete Vehicle Engineering team consists of 12 team members. We work in an agile setup in the intersection where hardware meets software. As part of our system engineering team, your focus will be on leading system development through early system development and tailoring solutions for our customers' business needs.
  
  

For this position as System Engineer your responsibilities will include:
  
  

* Take the role as Pre-study Leader focusing on design of system solutions for autonomous vehicles (forklifts). A safety-critical system including both hardware and software.
* Work with robotics technologies such as localization, perception-based navigation, and vision systems.
* Define products and platforms, and ensure standard compliance.
* Cross-functional collaboration including customers and product management.
* Contribute to continuous refinement of our way of working.


We're looking for people who bring a mix of the following skills and experiences:
  
  

* A degree in Applied Physics, Electrical / Electronics, Mechatronics, Computer Science or equivalent.
* Experience from early development phases, such as concept development and pre-studies.
* Experience within the field of systems engineering.
* Experience within a relevant field preferably related to software engineering, e.g. design of autonomous vehicles or other system design.
* Experience of technical leadership, e.g. for products, platforms, projects or programs.
* Proficiency in both spoken and written English. Proficiency in Swedish is a plus.


You love to solve cross-functional technical challenges, combining a systematic approach with business focus. Staying updated on industry trends, you actively contribute to defining strategies for systems and components. Your strong communication skills help foster a positive and supportive team environment. We believe that your attitude is as important as your skills!
  
  

Who is R&D Toyota Material Handling?
  
Toyota Material Handling is a world leader in material handling and we are making large investments to meet the needs of the future. At our R&D department in Mjölby, 300 employees work on the development of our products and services as well as new innovative solutions. At Toyota, we work with a holistic perspective where employees have responsibility from concept to finished product.
  
At Toyota, we combine classic design with modern technology in automation, IoT and AI. Our product portfolio ranges from manual hand trucks to driverless vehicles with advanced technology. In the R&D department, we work with short development cycles to meet the demand of a rapidly growing market.
  
  

Together, we work in cross-functional teams with agile working methods. Everyday life at R&D alternates between theory and practice, with great opportunities for our engineers to test their new technical solutions in practice in our extensive modern test lab. Our large-scale production lies side by side with R&D, which creates good conditions for direct feedback from the practical application of the products.
  
  

The employees in R&D describe our managers and leaders as inclusive, attentive and without prestige. We at Toyota are keen to create a familiar working climate with opportunities for personal development and good career prospects.
  
  

Toyota as an employer
  
At Toyota Material Handling, we strive to be a friendly, safe, and progressive workplace. The culture is based on Toyota's values, where respect and caring actions are key words in the daily work. Our ambition is to strengthen competitiveness by increasing diversity in operations and taking advantage of differences. Through our environmental work, ambitious climate goals and our personnel policy, we work to be a sustainable employer.
  
In order to create the conditions for a sustainable everyday life, we offer our employees flextime and the opportunity to work remotely on a part-time basis. We have good training opportunities with free access to gyms and group training, as well as a generous wellness allowance.
  
  

Application
  
Send your application no later than2025-12-07.
  
If you are applying for a job and have a protected identity you should contact HR, who will guide you further for a secure application process.
  
  

**For more information please contact:**  

* Maria Strahl, Manager Complete Vehicle Engineering,maria.strahl@toyota-industries.eu
* Matilda Norberg, Talent Acquisition Partner, matilda.norberg@toyota-industries.eu


**Instagram:** ToyotaMHsweden
  
**Linkedin:** Toyota Material Handling Manufacturing Sweden AB
